text: Great blush but I should have read the ingredients before buying.  It is full of parabens.  I ended up buying a bare minerals blush instead so I'm not rubbing parabens all over my babys face all day.  Will keep this for special occasions but use my bare minerals for everyday use.

Overall it does the job but a once over is not enough.
In the past I have used the Schick Quattro trimmer and it is fantastic. I will buy it again when I need a new trimmer, and it's only about $10.
This Panasonic did not meet my expectations, and I will not purchase it again nor recommend it to others.
Harmless. Doesn't last long. Cheap.
Expensive.  I refill them with rubbing alcohol now.
Much better as a scheduled recurring purchase , than as 6 unit pack.  Used to be 6/6 stars for product and convenience. Now convenience is down to 1/6 stars.  What an inconvenience now!
Looks sharp, seems well constructed. Owned for 2-3 weeks.

They only sent me 1 packet out of the 6. I ordered a quantity of 2, so I should receive a total of 12 oacks.
It came very late, like after a few weeks and when it finally arrived...it was short 10 boxes. I was charged $38 for 2 boxes. WHen I called Amazon customer service, the gentleman stated that they don't have these anymore. Ardell lashes are good and this combo pack is a great price, if they send it all to you. It's best to contact the seller BEFORE you purchse from them.
Simple and classy. Functional and small enough to fit on a very small counter like ours. My husband was happy and I am too. It shines well. Overall, good purchase.

It works well, but the charge runs out fast, to the point that you should either leave it on the charger daily, if you're a hirsute constant groomer, or plan sessions 12 hours in advance so the device has adequate time to power up. good, not great. it's a fine choice and i would probably buy this one again
Nice stand.  Well polished.  Holds razor and brush very well
I purchased this razor, and it stopped working, so they sent me a replacement.  Within a few weeks, the replacement also stopped working! Very disappointed.
Too thin. It would be better if it were a bit thicker.

I bought this shaver thinking it was better than my old Quad Norelco.  It is not because it doesn't have some of the features I expected.  I am disappointed that what was a simple Norelco shaver now has so many features that it is impossible to tell the better ones from the standard ones, except for prices differences.  When I look on the web (Amazon and Norelco) it would be great if there was a side-by-side chart comparing all the fetures of all the Norelco shavers.  That would do a lot to help customers sort out which features and prices range work the best for them.  It is easier to buy a car because at least the manufacturer has grouped the options so that customers don't have to look at 20 simular but different cars (other than colors).

My experience with Norelco shavers extends over thirty years.  Owning more expensive models, I received an average of ten years economical service from each on my elderly face with a fairly light beard.  Having reviewed a number of current models, the 7140 seemed most cost-effective.  After using it for a month, I have determined the following:  PRO's - It is designed to fit the hand well and the flip-type head simplifies cleaning.  CON's - No sliding scale indicator to show state of charge.  Runs at a relatively slow speed with slower shaving time. Bulky external transformer at end of charging cord.  No storage case or pouch.

Did not come in a box also states that it's Lemonfresh. It's not. Will not be buying it again. You have a pictures of something you are selling then you send something different to the buyer in my book. You are not telling the truth.

As my title says this trimmer is the keystone cops of beard trimmers. The people who call this trimmer good must have peach fuzz for beards. The vacuum is a waste of money, it keeps getting clogged so you have to take it apart two or three times during trimming to keep it working. DON'T take apart the vacuum too much to clean as the spring inside is loose and it ended up in the trap of my sink. And finally forget the settings. I start off with a three setting for example and notice some of my beard is shorter than other parts and look at the settings and somehow the thing has slipped to #2. So then you do a 2 only to find out it has slipped again to 1. If you want a laugh buy this thing but if you want a trim don't buy it. Where is my old definition sixty which was battery operated but was better than this. Go back to the drawing board and do away with all the gadgetry and come out with something that trims beards properly and maintains the settings. Is that too much to ask??

This pendulum matches well with the clock a friend gave me and the adjustment of the leaf when I received it has been very close to perfect for the clock to keep good time.  I am very pleased with this purchase and would choose to buy from this company again should I need something else for any of my German clocks.

I thought this product would be appropriate as I get into a more traditional method of shaving.  Order was promptly fulfilled and shipped.  I like the classic design which matches well with the Merkur Barber Pole razor I purchased.  Stand looks sharp and functions very well with both my brush and razor, allowing both to properly dry.
Got as gift for my husband with shaving brush. Doesn't really fit the brush but he will need to decide whether or not he wants to keep it. Other reviews had warned of the same thing.
Great quality, functional product. No complaints.

After reading both good and bad reviews for this product, I purchased it to trim my husbands beard (after his old trimmer died). It does a decent job of trimming. The nose hair attachment doesn't work. The micro foil attachment rips hairs out rather than cutting them. The attachments are made of cheap plastic so handle with care.

I was looking for an spf face lotion for everyday and this one is just too thick for daily.  I was going to use it at the beach but being that its only an spf of 15 it won't work for that either.  Since I can't return it I guess I'll chalk it up as a lesson learned.  Don't buy cosmetic type products online unless you've tried them first or they have a good return policy.
Great
Not bad but it could have had better vacuum, or at least it could have sucked in hair better. Over all it was decent.
Looks nice but my razor will not stay on the stand, it falls off.

Perfecto Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand - The Best Safety Razor Stand!!! This Will Prolong The Life Of Your Shaving Brush. I am glad I bought the stand, its really well built and the chrome plating was really A-1. It even looks good on vanity. You can't go wrong for the price it costs. Sold by Pop! Shop and Fulfilled by Amazon
Outstanding quality and shave
Very nice. Holds my Gillette Fusion and synthetic shaving brush in the correct position & looks great

Don't believe anybody who writes that this product works, because it does not and cannot - the whole conscept of killing hair roots by electric current is false and utopic because it's been proved that the hair is not an electric current transistor (even if it's completely wet, the electric current won't penetrate below the skeen surface).
Note to Tamy (previous review): - it's obvious that this review has been fabricated, because she writes about her own exprience and then suddenly announces that this product works on all hair types and colors. How can the person have multiple hair types or colors? It's an obvious advertisement.

This is a VERY nice stand! Has nice weight to it and is made extremely well!
Holds the brush and razor securely, so there is no concern there.
Looks beautiful on the bathroom counter.  Highly recommend!!!

I really wanted it to work for me, but it didn't. Hair felt like straw, it left a lot of residue in my hair and made my hair freeze straight, as in my daughters would pull on my ponytail to make it stick straight out and laugh at me. I have fine, straight hair and used this with Dr. Bronners citrus rinse based on another reviewer, it was a mistake. Tried a full 3 weeks and used exactly to package specifications. I would NOT recommend. My thinking is that the positive reviews are all compensated endorsers. I was really hoping to forgo traditional shampoos and conditioners for health, and this is my second attempt at trying, and it was yet another fail. Don't buy.
I used this 3 times.  Never touched a drop of water. Now it doesn't work. What a waste!

I got it from Whole Foods to use on my face at night to take away inflammation and make my skin flawless overnight. This product is good, but it doesn't work as well as the Now brand. The girl at Whole Foods said this was a more reputable brand because they specialize it facial products, but I really think the other brand called "Now" works much better for skin care.

I do not like the new style of this 1514 brush iron.  I like the older version much better.  Reasons being this new style's brushes are further apart and shorter in which case I burn my fingers easily when using it.  This never happened with the older version.

The razor fall from this stand
I had to fixit
I like it
Guards hard to keep on
Not sure it is as good as they say it is. How can you tell?  I may try it one more time,
As advertised and good for the price
i love  the razor and stand
Not expensive yet does the job perfectly.
Well made and looks great!
Very useful! I was skeptical about needing these but I have to say I am very happy with the purchase.
too expensive
Too large for bottom lashes!

I bought this for my husband b/c he has three razors he uses in stages.  I was hoping to eliminate them all with this one.  however, he goes a few days without shaving and he said it pulled the hair.  it was okay once the hair was cut shorter (using one of the other, older shaver that he has).  so then i decided to try it on my legs since I spent the money and the box was torn up and in the garbage (i didn't think i would be able to return it without the box).  I figured since leg hair is pretty fine, it would work sufficiently.  I guess it works okay if I wirl it in circles, but it doesn't work good enough.
works good and looks good
Piece of crap. Wouldn't even heat up enough to warm my hair, much less curl it. I offered to return it but they just gave me a full refund so I threw it away.
There were other stands that were more expensive, but the polished look of this is super nice. Also, its very sturdy and holds everything, no problem.
I was u see the impression I was purchasing more then one
Looks nice on counter!
What?!! It makes foam... and yucky scent.

Appears as shown, though it wobbles. I did not know that before I received it. This might be to allow the top to swivel, though I'd prefer it didn't. Still, it performs its function perfectly and seems quality enough.
Very sturdy product.  Fits all my needs.
I have used this product before but the item shipped to me must have been old and dried out, it was like putting on clown makeup.  It expires on sept 2016, so I assume it is old.
very good product.  I will enjoy using it.
I thought it was a bargain price, but it actually cost more than if I had bought it locally.
This was to sticky
i use them to fine cut paper

the photo in order was not for the "new more sustainable formula"  i was very careful to check for that.  i can get this formula anywhere for no shipping cost.  now i am stuck with it  because shipping the return is not worth it.  the new formula has too much zinc so it does not absorb into skin.
Did not stay in the holder very long, the netting fell apart shortly after a couple of uses.  Would never buy again

Whelp, I've used this stand for a couple months now. Nearly every other day, I have to remove the bottom and tighten the screw. Not sure why it kept coming loose. My razor also kept falling off the stand, and had to be carefully arranged. So, about the 3rd time in a week I found myself having to adjust the screw and carefully place the razor on the stand, I finally chucked the whole thing back where I assume it came from: the garbage.
Hard to use; takes time to fit to teeth.
Quality product. Great service!
Great looking product. I love the extra bit for the razor. The rubber bottom helps the stand stay in one place.

I bought the product for it's reviews. I used to use a whal hair trimmer, and I lost it. I decided to purchase this to get me by. All I can say is that I don't reccommend this product due to it pulling hairs and not giving a clean cut. I'm curious as to why other people gave it good reviews. It might just be me.

Just received my Badedas .  I had ordered what I thought was original.  It turns out toe be Classic Original .  Which is not original at all.  It seems to be the new formula.  Which does not come close to being as good as the original.  It is sad to see a good product, made into a cheap imitation.  Save your money.  I have used the original for many, many years.  I ordered three bottles for $52.  I could have gotten a better copy in the grocery store for five dollars a bottle.
This was a great Purchase! Great price for the great quality.

This is my first time using a safety shaver.  I knew I needed a stand for my brush.  This is the one I got, when it arrived and I picked it up out of the box, I was IMPRESSED, it looked amazing, and it had heft.  I was expecting something like you might find in the dollar store.  But this stand is solid, it will not be tipping over, it being stainless steel, it will last for a very long time.  My expectation is I will be passing down to my Grandson, He is 4, and I just know he will be able to use it.
The cap was not closed all the way. It leaked more than half of the bottle. No use.
Died after less than 2 months of use. Don't waste your money.
Great product and looks great with my razor and brush.  I would readily recommend this stand.

No problem with the quality.  Very sturdy with good weight and nice design.  I should have paid closer attention to the width opening for the brush because it does not fit my Art of Shaving badger brush.  No problem though, since my next brush will not be purchased from that company (just too expensive) and I will make sure it fits.

I am disappointed in it.  I have a Conair bristle brush that works very well but it is larger.  My hair is short and coarse so I thought the 1/2 inch brush would do well.  There do not seem to be enough bristles on the brush to grab hair.  I do not recommend it.
Does just what it is supposed to do. I have a long-handled safety razor, so I do wish it was just a tiny bit taller, but it still serves its purpose and looks good doing it.
Superior quality and fits my shaving brush perfectly. The weight distribution and metal material looks as great as it performs.
Real nice brush and razor fit real well
Stopped working after just one use.  Returned for full refund.  Might be good if it had actually worked longer.  Not willing to buy another one to try.
Excellent value and quality. Went to a mall shaving store to see what they had and this was so much better on all fronts!

The tape is the fibrous type of tape, not the plastic / smooth type.
The yearn that makes up the floss is from the USA, but everything is "processed" in the Dominican Republic.
This is definitely for people with widely spaced teeth. If you are not sure if your teeth are wide-spaced I'd say keep looking for something else.
Its perfect for my husbands existing razor and the badger brush I bought him

I purchased this item twice and received both of the items with the same defect: the stem is loose. The whole stem rocks back and forth to the point that it is unusable. Unfortunately, short of removing the glued on mat at the bottom (and damaging the item), there's no way to screw it in. Since the reviews are generally excellent and thinking this may be a one-time defect, I ordered a second one (there was no exchange option available on Amazon) and the issue on the second item was identical. So I will be returning both. 05/06/16: Per my comment below on this review, I have attached a video for reference. This video was created using the second stand that I purchased. I did not initially include the video as I did not think it was necessary; however, since Jessica, the representative, is stating that it is a 'shipping' defect, this may be helpful in showing that it is actually an assembly issue.
sent them back...no better than the old ones.  bad product...will never buy norelco again.....

The razor and brush stand are exactly what I wanted.  It is solid, has good weight and nicely holds my razor and brush.  I did try a disposable travel razor and that didn't work so well, but for my everyday razor it looks great and works well.

I would buy this again.

Sorry, but first, I have to say that  I bought this product by accident.  I had previously bought the other patchouli soap on Amazon that comes in the brown box with a ribbon before and really, really liked it.  So, when I ordered soap again, having used the old one down to a sliver, I somehow clicked the wrong product. Of course, scent is always a personal preference, but to me, this one doesn't have much scent compared to the other, and didn't fit in my loofa/washcloth holder that I use the way the other one did.  Also, what scent it did have didn't smell like patchouli or even very pleasant to me,nor did it produce much lather.
Used once. Left in shower. Never worked again.
very good
Nice companion to the razor and brush, wish they would offer a set rather than having to order separately.
Love this razor stand! Works perfect for my husband. I thought about getting one for me.

When my old Vidal Sassoon hot air brush died, I ordered a couple of devices to try to replace it, this being one of them. If it isn't too late, I will return this, as it isn't hot enough to do much of anything on my gray, curly short hair. Perhaps if you have very fine hair and cannot use anything too hot on it, this might work for you.
While in theory, this is wonderful stand for the brush, it does not work for the razor.. which keeps sliding out of its holder.
Extremely high quality!

This lasted me about two years of in frequent use. It did not give me a very close shave unless i pushed very hard, and when i pushed hard it tended to cut me. I tried both wet and dry shaving and i found that dry worked better but still not as well as i would've liked. It also had severe problems shaving the neck/adam's apple area.
However, the blade lasted a long time and it was good for touchup or when in a rush.

I've purchased 3 of these razors in the past several years. They do a great trim job, so I have no issues with that. my 3 star rating is due to the fact that every single one of these I've owned has developed a problem with the on/off switch. After about  a year of usage, the power button feels like it has been sucked into the body of the razor and within a few weeks of that happening, the on/off switch completely fails to work. On 2 of these, the power button failed while the razor was on...thus, I could not turn it off and had to let it run itself out.
I got this for a gift. I was very pleased with my purchase. The stand is a nice sterling silver that has a solid bottom.
Does exactly what it needs to. Nothing exceptional about quality, but it definitely doesn't seem poorly made. I have had no problems at all with it.

As the subject said.  I was hoping to get the product pictured as it is superior in every way to the inferior replacement 51S.  The description also says "Braun 8000 Activator Combi-Pack Foil and Cutterblock" which is also incorrect.  Everything about this listing is wrong, and you should not buy this.

For what it's worth, you can probably get it cheaper from someone else if you want the 51S, by the way.

I always ignore reviews when people shout "DO NOT BUY", but I'm now writing one.  BUYER BEWARE.  DO NOT BUY.  I can't believe Amazon lets this go on.
Elegant, stylish and practical. A great addition to any bathroom.
Did not work as well as I was hoping, will stick with the Desitin for future diaper rash issues.

Takes forever to heat up.  The size is what I was looking for.  I previously had used the Belson 1" brush curling iron but those aren't made anymore.  Finally found the Helen of Troy and the size is right but it doesn't heat up enough and takes forever to get to the hottest temperature it finally reaches.
What a gorgeous, solid piece!  It looks great on our black granite vanity top.  Nice balance, great finish.  Couldn't be happier.  Prompt delivery, too!
PRODUCTO REGULAR Y DE UN SOLO VOLTAJE
Very good quality razor/brush stand.
Defective pouches and cannot be loaded at the top as customary. Must place soap in bottom and elastic band not taut enough to hold the soap within it.

I purchased this item for my husband and he absolutely loved it!
Razor stand is sturdy, has an elegant look that easily complements any decor.

As electric shavers go, this one is OK.  It's better than the Norelco but not quite as good as the latest Remington triple-head. Of course, it's not as loud as the Remington either. But, let's face it, if you want a close shave, you're going to have to use a blade and shaving cream or gel. It takes about twice as long (or longer) to get a decent shave with any electric.  However, this shaver is fun because of the cleaning feature and the various LED readouts on the deluxe model. It's hard to rate its longevity because I've only had it a few weeks.  The motor seems to drag where my beard is heaviest.  Also, the fan in the cleaning unit sounds like it's struggling to get up to speed during the drying mode of the cleaning operation.  To sum up: a fun toy but nothing to write home about.
ok
Received the wrong item. Ordered the oil free moisturizer and received the soothing moisturizing creme
Great brush, works good!  Happy with purchase

The Oral B Hummingbird is completely useless as a floss or toothpick replacement.  The picks and flosser heads are better used without the hummingbird if anything.  If you purchase this item you will simply be recieve a device with a "cute" appearance that vibrates like a pager but does nothing to help clean your teeth.  Honestly, I do not recommend anyone purchasing this product unless they want to use it as a display item on your desk.

I was looking for replacement shaver heads for my older Noreclo model 6613X electric shaver.  On the shaver it says to only use HQ55+ replacement heads.  This seller had the only HQ55+ heads on Amazon.  Do not buy the HQ55 or HQ55+ from this or any other seller.  Norelco no longer makes either.  Instead, this seller will send you HQ56 replacement heads, which works just as well but can be purchased for about $4 less directly from Amazon (plus no shipping if you are an Amazon Prime customer).  No where in the product description does the seller indicate this is actually an HQ56 rather than an HQ55, which is deceptive and will cost more for the same product.  The HQ56 heads are fine.  It is nice to have a nice close shave again, I only wish I did not feel as though I was taken advantage of by an unscrupulous advertiser.

This was a gift for my husband.  So far he likes the brush and holder.  As described in an email from the company, the brush did lose some hairs in the beginning but that has subsided.  I feel it was a good purchase.
Does not lather well and have not noticed a difference in my hair
This didn't really work on my polishes. It just stayed in there.
This really dries out my hair and makes it feel even thinner than it already is. The smell is nice, but consistency is pretty much water. I honestly think most of the reviews are false

At first I thought this was a decent and affordable trimmer.  That is until is stopped working less than 6 months after I got it.  I tried changing the batteries and cleaning it, but it won't turn on.  I would not recommend this product.
Love my wax pot but the plastic cover was broken off.  Can I get another cover?
I tried the advanced seal and it was so much better in terms of convenience. If you are going to buy this product than buy the white strips that have the advanced seal.
It is good but too much to clean after I finished waxing. It is hard as well. I will go bake to honey one and not cream one.
I just recently got into wet shaving, and like most people, I needed to get a stand for my razor and brush.  This stand is perfect!  Very heavy duty and well balanced.
Holds the brush and the razor. Has a foam type bottom so it doesn't shift. Does it's job. Looks nice in silver.
I was disappointed in the length ot time needed to recharge the razor.  The old Norelco,  five years old, required one and one half hours to recharge, The new one takes sixteen hours.

This stuff is awful! What a waste of money...it leaves a thick, white layer on your face and even after rubbing it in as much as possible it leaves your face feeling greasy. I broke out almost immediately and had to throw it in the garbage. That money went right down the drain, grrr.
Not my favorite hair-curler that I've bought - doesn't seem to heat up high enough to curl my hair and my hair is generally fairly susceptible to a curling iron
I will not buy this again!
Love it!
I can not speak much of this item, because the reception of the hotel I was staying, lost NARS Amour blush that I bought.

I am a 30 year Norelco user who also owns a five year old Norelco 6885XL which was the top of Norelco's line when purchased. In my opinion the new Smart Touch line that uses the HQ9 heads is not worth the upgrade. I buy new heads once a year, which makes my older shaver feel like new. The only real reason to upgrade a Quadra/HQ7 Norelco is if the batteries are failing--and there are numerous places now where you can have your dying batteries replaced.

Don't fall for "the latest is always better" line.
Works great and as described. Perfect for standard brush and razor. Essential for any gentleman.
works great.

I bought this stand for my son as a Christmas gift.  It looks great and it has a sold, stable quality to it.  I hope he likes it!!
I may even buy one for myself.....
nice look. fits perfectly for my brush and razor

my teeth were defiantly whiter after using, but the gel inside the trays is annoying to spread over all of your teeth and most of the time it falls out and it seems like you are wasting your money, next time i am getting white strips rather then trays.
Took almost a week to get. No color. Not really what I expected after having a soap bar scrubber before, just not worth any more than maybe $1.
It did not get hot enough to curl my hair.
This stand is fantastic especially with a chrome razor. I was really impressed with the weight of it and quality of the product

(1) Short,coiled cord is a a pain. Threw it out and used the long staright cord from my old Norelco.

(2) Fine shave if you aren't going out in public. It gets the easy parts, but below th chin I might just as well not have shaved. Thank God I'm retired. This wouldn't do if I had to make a business call.

Thought this would be a good buy to save a few of my favorite nail polishes that have thickened up a bit. WRONG!!!! It came as expected but the package was leaking and as I thought it was because the bottle had opened during its travel to me. It spilled out half the bottle and now has left a very strong and foul chemical smell in my home. The parts of my hands that came into contact with the product as I cleaned it up dried out instantly!! I was afraid to use it in my nail polishes but did any ways. It thins then out alright to a point you can't even get a solid color!! I didn't even use but a few drops when I tried it and my nail polish is now runny instead of thick and chunky. Ugh!!! Very dissatisfied with this product!!!!

Being a hairdresser, I have used curling irons for years.  This one was okay but I have come close to burning my fingers and face a few times.  If the spikes were longer it would grab the hair easier and not need your hand to hold your hair around the barrel.  Longer spikes and more narrow spaces between them would also prevent accidental burns to your face.

This is my 4th year using this calendar. I absolutely love it for quick visual reminders of medications, appointments and etc. It really helps me take care of my elderly parent, family and dog! I use my I-phone calendar, but there is nothing like a quick peak at large calendar placed in a prominent place!

For the price and the value, you can't go wrong with this one. So many different detachable heads, you can probably cut your hair with this thing as well.

Pros:
-Cheap
-Has everything you need for grooming
-Decent battery and life
-Comes with everything you need to use for travel

Cons:
-Cheap, poor quality, plastic heads makes it annoying to trim
-Feels like a cheap cut
-Bulky design on the heads/could be a lot more slimline for all the other buzzers I have see
-Detach button is right next to the on/off button and it larger/easier to press in comparison. I detach the head more often than I turn the darn thing on and off.

All in all, you get what you pay for. No more or no less. A good value, but given enough time I could have found something better.
This was a lot more heavy duty than I was expecting, very sturdy, very clean and nicely constructed, great buy!
Don't like the handle. Rather fat and hard to hold
The product was shipped as described.  It looks great and does a great job of holding my razor and shaving brush.  It was perfect and simple, exactly what I was looking for!
Good.

Works perfectly. Until you drop it. Seriously, all it takes is one drop to ruin the product to the point of uselessness. The first time I bought it, I used it for a good year until I dropped it on my tiled bathroom floor and the blades got screwed up. When I bought a replacement, to my horror, I dropped it right when I opened the package onto my wood flooring. When I tested it out, the blades were screwed up. So frustrating and disappointing. Yet I keep on buying it... If you buy this, make sure to treat it as if it were fine China. I should not have to say that about a trimmer...

This is a stylish and sturdy stand that can hold your fancy razor (or the one using disposable cartridges...) and your brush. Not only does it look nice, it actually works fine and doesn't wobble, pretty solid and balanced and you can be sure your stuff is going to be kept in place.
nice for large curls
When it worked, it was great. However it broke after maybe two weeks. I tried replacing the batteries and it didn't help.

value for money is not quite there with this. I love the oil though, it's light and give a subtle glow. it's said to help with age spots, wrinkles and scarring, I love it for the glow and softness alone

I have had this perfecto razor stand for over 6 months and I love it. I keep it in my shower all the time as that is where I shave. It is heavy and stays put. It does not slide around or fall over. It has shown no signs of rusting or buildup even in the very hard water conditions of my shower. Highly recommended.
They test on animals meaning this product is officially ruined for me
Super cute- baby loved it

This product had someone's pubic hair on it when I took it out of the packaging. If you buy this product, inspect closely before using. I don't know how well it works, because it went right back in the box.
I liked it so much I bought another one for another bathroom.

It may be a good cream, but the stale smell
of it is unpleasant enough that I don't use it all that often (and have to follow with a better scented lotion when I do).
Easy! Watch a YouTube vid and voila

While the concept of the built in comb is a good one, this design just does not work well and don't count on the vacuum catching all your clippings because it can only hold about half the volume of a shot glass. I ended throwing mine away and switching back to my old Oster hair clippers with the snap on combs for my head and bought a small rechargeable Waring beard trimmer. The twist dial for the comb length on this unit can be wrong - I gouged my beard/sideburns once with this unit. The comb unit must be removed for frequent cleaning and putting it back on correctly takes a delicate touch. The large size of the unit and comb also makes it verr difficult to trim your moustache close to your nose. Don't waste your money.
I would highly recommend this stand.

Love Boyd's calendars.  Good quality and great for Teddy Bear lovers.
I get one for Christmas every year and enjoy it!

When Colgate took "Simply White" off the market I was devastated.  It actually whitened my teeth better than anything else and was cheaper and easier to use.  Aquafresh White Trays don't whiten as well and are not that easy to use.  I don't know who they're making the trays for because I have a pretty small mouth and I can hardly get them to cover my teeth.  And I've tried many different strategies, too.  I'm not crazy about the Whitestrips either.  I don't find that they whiten enough.  I'm hoping something new comes out one of these days that really works!
Might just be me but using those waxing stripes are difficult and no hair removal happens. Would not recommend to anyone.
Handsome stand for my Perfecto brush and Merkur HD.  Tall enough to handle a variety of different razors as well.

You can't really expect a lot from this all purpose groomer since it is cheap; it is basically jack-of-all-trade but master of none. Its performance is just above average, good enough for normal use, but won't satisfy you if you have high expectation. Overall I must say that I am happy with this product. So if you are like me, not really picky and just want to have it all cheap in one package, then this might be the groomer you need. Else, you better off get everything separately.

Ok overall, however some of the features of the grooming system have very little use. The shaver, for example, does not provide a very close shave at all. Same with some other features. Bottomline - don't hold your breath.

This is the third Norelco shaver I have owned and the second rechargeable.  My first rechargeable was wonderful.  This one is junk.  It barely turns fast enough to use when plugged in or immediately after a recharge.  The charge only lasts one-two days where my old one would hold a charge for two weeks with daily use until it died of old age after about 12 years of use!

Pass this one by no matter how cheap someone offers to sell it!

This stand looks good but I don't know what kind of razor it is supposed to hold! My husband has a common, multi-blade manual razor. It immediately falls off when placed in this stand. Waste of money!
Fits the brush perfectly. Looks great on the counter. Very happy with the product and the fast shipping. Thanks.
The blades aren't very sharp. They catch and pull on the hair (ouch!) too often instead of just cutting it.

I wanted a light moisturizer with SPF to protect my face on the drive to work. I wear light makeup, so something that would soak in well and not be greasy is necessary. This is NOT that product. I've never used a greasier lotion. Since I wear SPF 30 when I'm outside for long periods of time, I guess this will get tossed in the trash.

Was not impressed with it at all.  Teeth were too far apart and the heat was really very hot.  My hair is a little fine so this did not help me at all.  My hair would slip through the teeth and made it hard to use.

Really don't like this shaver.  I've used it a couple of times-- doesn't shave as close as I would like even on the lowest setting.  If you take the cover off and try to use it, it hurts my skin.  Not a fan.  Can't return it now-- so I guess I'll just have to get another one.
Bought this for my husband after doing a lot of research on different brands.  It is really a beautiful stand (better than in the picture) - he loves it!
Total waste of money. This trimmer doesn't work.  I'll probably just donate it to Goodwill, if they take personal products. Remington has a trimmer that works very well but I can't find it anymore.

This is a great product carried by Pop! Shop! It is very solid and stable. Very well made. I can only recommend this product offered by Pop! Shop! Absolutely essential if you are truly serious about your shaving kit.

This thing cut me up a bit... not as bad as previous electric trimmers/razors I tried, but it's not quite as suited to "sensitive areas" as they say.  The problem is the top and bottom trimmer blades (the ones that are not under the foil) catch your skin (even when you're trying to hold it taut), especially in concave areas.  There needs to be a way to turn them off independently of the blades under the foil, and/or the teeth should be much finer (like the little "finishing touch" shavers) so your skin won't slip in between the teeth.

The blades under the foil did not irritate my skin and they made a pretty close shave.

Battery: There is no battery meter, and you're not supposed to leave it in the charger 24/7 (because it's NiMH), so there are issues not having enough charge to finish the job (until the next day after you charge it). I'd actually rather just have a NiCd battery for this application (because you can leave them in the charger 24/7, like a Sonicare toothbrush, and it won't hurt the battery life).

For the price this is a decent shaver... I'd give it 5 stars if Philips/Norelco could fix the issues I talked about.
Not enough teeth in the iron to keep the  hair in place on the iron.  It didn't work for my hair.

Very nice stand. Holds the razor and brush and has a nice gleam to it. Do note that this is for a standard size brush handle! I do have a few brushes (Stirling badger for instance) that while they do fit, are hanging on more of a balancing act rather than flush in the stand. Not a problem as long as you're aware!

This product is not for acne! While this product does contain vitamins A (retinol), E (tocopherol) , & C (ascorbyl palmitate) in a form that can be used by the skin (many other skin products do not) it also contains many hazardous ingredients, especially for acne suffers like fats, fatty acids, cholesterol, wax, and silicone oils; these ingredients will moisturize but also clog pores, make skin shiny, and may give people milia. In addition to this it contains trithanolamine a pH balancing ingredient that has been linked to cancer among many other health problems.

Retinol, a form of vitamin A is less stable, and less potent than prescription Vitamin A products, and could be less irritating to some but still has the potential to cause serious skin irritation. However even if Afirm had no Vitamin A, the other ingredients here including the additives that are meant to stabilize the retinol and prevent it from breaking down before it gets on your skin, are enough to cause serious reactions. I am shocked that DermaDoctor both recommends and sells this product without any warning. Any prescription vitamin A product would be much safer; there is much work to be done to make this product better!
good item for its price

It did the job but it felt a little bit bulky sometimes and it was hard to reach a clean trim at some places. The guard didn't feel secure and it was pretty useless since the closet trim was still pretty long. I ended  up not using the guard.  I took the trimmer apart for a deep cleaning but once I put it back together it didn't  work anymore. Shame I only used it for a couple months and it broke on me.

Very good product.  The newer Braun shavers, series 7 and series 9, both of which I have, allow the cleaning solution to evaporate much quicker than the older shavers.  The level of fluid goes down fairly quickly even if the shaver is not used.  In a dry climate, the level of cleaning solution in the cartridge will not last one month, regardless of use.  Evaporation loses more fluid than cleaning.  This is good for Braun, but not good for the customer.

I've been using Natural Instincts semi-permanent hair dye happily for three years when, out of the blue, I had an allergic reaction to the patch test. I'd always kind of rolled my eyes about doing the test, but I did it anyway "to be safe." I stopped rolling my eyes last month after that little quarter-sized spot in the crook of my elbow turned red, broke out in hives, and was unbearably itchy for days. PPD sensitization is real, people!

I bought this alternative from the Tints of Nature brand because the product page advertised "lowest possible levels of PPDs," and I hoped I could get away with it. No such luck.

On the bright side, doing the patch test for Tints of Nature is easier than for other brands, because you don't have to mix the dye and the developer together. You just stick a Q-Tip into the dye solution, dab it on your skin, and go.

On the dark side, a couple of hours after dabbing my elbow with said Q-Tip, my skin turned red and puffy, just like it had for Natural Instincts. The hives and itching haven't hit me yet, but I expect they will.

I can't return the box because I've opened it (well, maybe I "could," but I wouldn't feel right about it), so I'll consider this a $11 PPD allergy test. It'll be nothing but temporary vegan colors for me from now on.

The rosewater itself smells fine, but I tried using it on my skin and it made me breakout like crazy. Don't know if it's just my skin or the product. I now have it in a spray bottle and use it when I've spent a lot of time outside as a kind of refreshing/perfume spray. I most likely won't be buying it again though since I'd originally purchased it as a toner for my skin. For reference, my skin is classified as combination & sensitive skin.

This is the second Norelco Razor that I have had in the last 6 years.  I previously had the 3605x model for three years; it did an okay job but seemed to tire after three years and it didn't shave the neck area all that well so I decided that I wanted a new shaver for Christmas a few years back.  I received this razor and was pleasantly surprised at first.  It gave me a close comfortable shave the first time I used it with no irritation.  Norelco states that three weeks are necessary for skin and beard to adjust, but this was not true for me.  I like that this razor has an LED display that makes it charge in an hour for 45 minutes of shave time unlike my other razor that took the entire day to charge.  As time went on I obtained an excellent shave on my face but it just didn't do an excellent job in the neck area.  I eventually decided to buy new replacemnt heads within the year and have had the razor for about eighteen months but shaves still don't improve.  Therefore beware of this razor!

I have had a cool skin razor for several years and always liked it. I finally got around to replacing the heads, and the difference in shave quality was dramatic (my old blades were at least 5 years old).  However, I only give this product three stars because the blade kit is expensive to replace yearly as recommended and only includes new blades, not an entire new blade assembly. I didn't expect this, but for $30 it would have been nice, especially since, as other reviewers have pointed out, the blades and assembly have a tendency to accumulate residue, particularly if you don't use the special Nivea shave cartridges. (I want to be able to use a big cheap can of Barbasol dam***!) Manufacturers are entitled to charge what they wish for their products, but I don't have to like it.

I might use this again in a few days for a touch up, but I have a feeling it will be the same game all over again, change clips and put it all back together again.

Other than this issue, fairly close shave and practice will make perfect. But, I'm going to look for another brand.

This one has a turbo speed which the T-3000 didn't have and which I don't need and have never used.  In short, the company has replaced an excellent product with one that is only good.

I've had this trimmer for about 1 year now. It doesn't get a lot of use, I only trim about every 1.5-2 weeks (yes, I'm a bit lazy like that). So at most, I've used the trimmer about 35 times. It should work longer and better than that.

A few uses ago I went to pull out the little plastic trimmings compartment and the front of the compartment pulled off, leaving the rest inside the unit. It appears that these pieces are just glued together.

The second strike is that it doesn't catch about 20% of the trimmed hair, even in Turbo mode. I've tried it trimming very short amounts of hair, or longer. It doesn't seem to matter much.

The third strike is that 2-3 times during a trimming I have to remove the trimming guide, and then the blades to remove hair from underneath the blades. I don't see why hair should get trapped under there, but it does and reduces the trimming ability significantly. I don't think I should have to dismantle the trimmer to trim my beard. It's done this since day one.

Otherwise, it works pretty well. With some patience and a bit of mess it does a pretty good job at trimming. This is my third Norelco trimmer, none of them seem to have much staying power, my other two had similar clogging issues with the blade, and both had the rechargeable battery die.
Seems like all replacement heads are too expensive. But even at that, these heads made my shaver cut like new. Overall a good purchase.

This item is great if you want to trim short hair cuts, good value for a great price. Lots of accessories, even a nose hair trimer! BUT... MAKE SURE YOU CHARGE IT COMPLETELY BEFORE USE! Coming from someone who works at a professional waxing clinic, I would not recommend this product to anyone. The wax strips are too small for the bikini area. I also found that these weren't able to pull out any of my coarse pubic hair. Instead it would rip out the weaker hairs & leave the stronger, thicker hairs in place, thus leaving a patchy & sticky mess. I had good expectations with this product because I thought that it was affordable & would get the job done. All I can say is "You get what you pay for". (And not to sound like an annoying salesperson, but if you're serious about waxing, Cirepil Escential Rose Wax is what my employers use. It's expensive but I know for certain that it works: Cirepil Escential Rose Wax Tin, 14.1 Ounce (Packaging May Vary))

I first bought a Norelco rotating reflex head shaver in the late 1970's -- I was a grad student with very little money but scraped enough together to buy the razor (expensive back then) because a close friend recommended it.  This technology immediately proved to give a terrific, easy shave, and I have stayed with the Norelco shaver line ever since.  The so-called "Lift and Cut" configuration has two sets of angled, stacked blades in the rotating shaver head, and I have every reason to believe that Norelco's illustrations and claims of their special effectiveness are correct.
  For many years I simply bought the least expensive Norelco reflex razor every few years and did not bother with replacement heads (a set of heads costs more than half of what the lowest-priced razor model costs).  Razor performance during this period of about 20 years was always great -- as the saying goes, they will have to pry these razors out of my cold, dead hands.
  Then, with the advent of Amazon and eBay, my approach changed in recent years.  Instead of buying new razors, I began saving some money by buying sets of new replacement heads on Amazon.  Also, I really liked the low-end, powerful Norelco 6423LC model that Norelco had discontinued (it is not rechargeable but is great for travel because it is 120/240 volt).  So, more recently I bought a few used 6423LC's on eBay and set them aside so that I would always have at least one for many years to come.
  After a few years of using replacement heads from Amazon, it gradually dawned on me that shaving had become a lot harder -- it took a lot more time, more passes, and harder pressure to complete a shave.  The degradation in shaving experience was kind of subtle at first but eventually I reached the conclusion that maybe something was really, really wrong with the replacement heads.  And it got to be very irritating indeed, figuratively and literally.
  I also bought and tried "Vollco Sharpening Heads", which are designed to hone the edges of worn-down Norelco reflex razor heads, but these did not succeed at all in getting me back to a great, easy shave.
  I reluctantly began to consider the possibility that the replacement heads from Amazon were counterfeit.  On the face of it this seems pretty improbable, because the head blades themselves are very intricate little devices with very close dimensional tolerances.  It seemed impossible that counterfeiters would develop the expensive equipment and processing skill to make a crummy imitation version of Norelco's heads and still hope to make money on them.  Also, the replacement heads from Amazon look excatly like those in a new razor, even under magnification.
  Nonetheless, about 9 months ago I decided to do a test by purchasing replacement heads directly from the Norelco website.  I put a couple of sets into the shopping cart and tried to check out, but the process repeatedly failed and I gave up back then.  What are the odds, right?  I figured maybe I was just wasting my time.
  However, a few weeks ago I traveled to see my sister and brother-in-law, and I threw one of my used razors from eBay into my carry-on.  Now, one thing I learned early on with these razors is that you have to empty out the shavings every time you use them in order to avoid buildup and jamming.  So, every morning I pull off the head assembly and tap it against the sink.
  To my surprise on the first morning using the eBay razor, there was about twice as much whisker material down the wall of the sink bowl as I was accustomed to seeing after every shave.  It was pretty dramatic, especially given that the razor had been used for an unknown number of shaves before I bought it on eBay.
  So, when I got home a few days later I went back to the Norelco website and persevered until, with their customer service help, I got two sets of replacement heads ordered and delivered.  Two days ago I loaded in a new set and turned on the razor.
  Big surprise at the outset -- it actually sounded noticeably different from what I had generally been hearing from various Norelco razors and head sets over the years.  And the shave was, finally, terrific and easy again!  I did not expect this at all, because it seems so COMPLETELY improbable that someone would go to the trouble of counterfeiting these intricate little devices.
  But with three new facts in hand (changed sound, more whisker material, and really great, fast shave again), the conclusion, however improbable, seems incontrovertible -- there is something wrong with the replacement heads.
  All things considered, my best guess is that these replacement heads sold on Amazon actually do come from the same factory in China where the good ones from Norelco are made, but are somehow being diverted and stolen from the production line at a point before some sort of final, critical manufacturing step(s) is carried out.
  For example, though I'm not a metallurgist, I do know that there are some highly specialized techniques and expensive equipment for hardening the surfaces of cutting edges, such as by using metal sputtering or ion implantation to harden just the first few layers of atoms on a metallic surface or edge.  These techniques can create highly specialized alloy surfaces or whatever.
  If Norelco's factory has high security for heads emerging from a final processing step but misses diversion and theft of heads from an earlier point in the production process, that would explain all the facts without having to invoke the idea of a totally separate counterfeiting plant.
  Obviously I will buy replacement heads ONLY from Norelco in the future.
  I hope this review helps some people.  I will be happy to provide whatever information I can to help skeptics understand that this review is genuine.  For example, I have (i) emails from Norelco's website showing my failed purchase attempt much earlier this year and the successful purchase a week ago, plus (ii) records of all my eBay razor purchases, and (iii) my purchases of replacement heads from Amazon:  Feb 26, 2007; Feb 10, 2008; Dec 20, 2009; Dec 12, 2010; Aug 5, 2011; Aug 21, 2012; July 29, 2013; and the Vollco sharpeners on Aug 21, 2012.
  I have nothing to gain from publicizing this information -- I'm just very pleased indeed with the outcome and grateful to Norelco for putting out a fine product for several decades now.

P.S.  Now that I have read some other reviews of these replacement heads, it seems possible that there actually is ALSO a counterfeit production source, because some reviewers said that the screens and blades failed immediately.  This would not happen with heads diverted from an intermediate step the Norelco production process.  I would guess that we are now deaing with at least two sources of problems with the replacement heads.  Or maybe Norelco retains control of one source that makes the high-quality heads that are available on Norelco's website but also enabled some other, less capable source to make the heads that work so poorly.

I am new to shaving with a double edge razor. I needed a stand to hold both the razor and the shaving brush. The Perfecto Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand has a stylish appearance and is functional. When I removed the stand from it's box, the stem wobbled alarmingly on the base. I tried to screw it down but to no avail. I removed the base pad and saw that there was a screw extending up through the base into the stem. After tightening the screw, the stand was rock solid. There is a sufficient amount of weight in the base to keep the stand upright and that also gives it a feel of quality. I use a Merkur long handle razor and an Escali 100% Pure Badger Shaving Brush. The stand, the razor, and the brush complement each other very well. I would highly recommend this product.

This is a very nice brush for creating short hair styles; the problem I have is the the plastic tip on the end is to short & therefore I end up burning my thumb/fingers as I run it thru my hair. I bought a Belson Pro & found the same problem with it. I am still trying to find a replacement for my Vidal Sassoon VS-111, if anyone finds one please let me know, thank you.

For the money it was a great deal!  However, compared to my higher end Braun it feels cheaply made with light plastics - has a very cheap feel to it.  Other than feeling like junk, its decent for the money.

Cream wax very sticky and difficult to remove. I have a few others from cosmetology school that say the very same. I had to buy the all purpose wax from Cosmo prof to replace the wax. Also am not sure the rest of the items are authentic because the print on the bottles are not as the ones in the store either . Overall the warmer is great and so are the cloth strips with sticks.
I didn't find it sharper compared to Merkur blades. Returning the 5 pack.  Quality of steel is good tough.

This trimmer works just fine as a trimmer, but any suggestion that you won't have a major clean-up job afterwards is just wrong.

The "vac" part of the "accu-vac" is a complete farce.
Can't say

What a rock solid hefty razor and brush stand! It can be hard reviewing something as simple as this but I will say a few things, all positive.
1. The stand is quite hefty and is perfectly designed to hold a heavy badger hair brush and a razor
2. The base is sufficiently heavy such that taking the brush and razor out of the holder doesn't cause it to move an inch. The cheaper ones will topple over, etc.
The knurled piece in the middle makes it easier to move it with wet hands. A necessity? No. A nice feature showing thought went into the design? Yes!

I'm very happy with this stand especially given the price
The barrel is larger than 1 1/2" it is to big for my hair length.
I got this a couple weeks ago and it's already broken and quit working.  The two times I did use it, it worked great.  I would love a replacement or refund though.  It was a waste of $20
Nice little stand. Works well with the new brush. I like the combination.
Spills to the side when you pour it due to its opening.
Not water resistant.
Doesn't seem to generate the amount of suds I would like.

Friday afternoon before my overseas vacation and my tooth broke. Of course there were no available dentist so I thought that this product would help fix my tooth until I got home.  I Don't waste your money or your time buying this product as it does not do what it claims.  I tried it to fix my broken molar.  The first time, the repair lasted 20 minutes, then fell off.  So I tried it again and wore my mouth guard to make sure that I did not bite down on the repaired tooth.  That fix lasted 3 hours.  Not enough time to get in to a dentist for a real repair.  $5 bucks down the drain.  I'll keep using it until it's gone, but I won't buy it again.
My husband loves this stand, for his shaving brush!
Arrived quickly and product is as advertised. However did not work at all for my wife as a bikini trimmer. She is white and has relatively coarse dark hair. Returned the product for a competitor.

Just as the name implies, perfecto! The quality and build of this razor and brush stand make it a great buy and one of the best on Amazon.  The stand is well-made, nicely weighted and has a soft padded cover under the base. It easily holds the several different style double-edged razors that I have with no problem as well as the classic badger shaving brush. It's a minimalist design but the stainless steel sets it off very nicely in any bathroom decor. A great buy which should last as long as the heirloom razor.

Worst product that I've ever purchased from Amazon. Completely useless. Wish I had read the previous reviews before making my purchase. The mesh bag would not hold soap and the item went directly into the trash.
What a beautiful way to display your necessities! Even if it wasn't already useful, it's pretty too!

The Norelco 8140XL is the best that you are going to get from an electric shaver.  I tried a Remington foil shaver and it was horrible.  It did a poor job of shaving, was VERY loud and made a mess of my bathroom when I cleaned it.
I returned it and bought the 8160XL because it was the same price as the 8140XL on Amazon.  The Jet Clean system is a waste of time and space.  You clean the cutting blades by opening the top and holding it under running water - done!  I don't see any reason to use the cleaning system.
If you can't use a multi-blade razor and need to go electric then I recommend the Norelco 8140XL.
My rating system:
*****(5 stars) - Good old multi-blade razor and shave cream (my old skin can't take blades anymore)
****(4 stars) - Norelco 8140XL
***(3 stars) - Norelco 8160XL
* (1 star) - Remington foil type shaver
Causes Awful breakouts. I am not one to have a lot of pimples, but this cream destroyed my skin.
Perfect for holding my brush and razor and has a classy look as well
just seems ok. blades are subjective but for me, I seem to get a better shave with the astra's or derby's. so far, sticking with astras as they work well and inexpensive.
completes are matching set!
Solid base for both brush and razor.
Brush iron so hot it broke/damaged fine hair.  Iron burned top of dresser.  I have purchased item before and did not have  any problems.
First time I tried to re-attach length guage after using trimmer, gauge broke.  Save yor money.
Broke after 1 year.

I bought this at CVS for $25 3 years ago. This trimmer is definitely not worth the price they are asking. I often found that I would get the metal prongs of the trimmer caught in my skin causing frequent bleeding. Maybe it was defective or I have big pores, but I have not had issues with other trimmers before this.
Still an good product but not of the same caliber as it was many years ago. The super-sharpness of the blades has deteriorated from what it was when originally manufactured in England.

I've only used this product twice within a couple of months from purchasing, and the heating element already went out. I purchased it January 8, 2015, and as of today, February 24, 2015, I am not able to replace for a new one The deadline for returns and replacement was February 14, 2015. I used the brush iron yesterday, and during the middle of using it, the heating element quit working. I unplugged it, plugged it back in, turned it off, then back on, and a little heat came on, but not hot enough to curl my hair. Therefore this product is of no use. I would like to have a reconsideration in replacing the brush iron for a new one.

The razor is the best yet. I`ve used them for almost 50 years. The cleaning system is something else;It didn`t work and i had to send the whole set back. It`s been about two weeks and no razor. Can`t wait to get it back.
Does the job to keep your nail polishes fresh and ready for use.
This was a gift. It arrived on time and works as expected. And it looks good..

I recently figured out that I have combination facial skin which knowing it before buying this stuff, I probably would have bought something else.  I feel like I have waisted my money in buying this product.  Every morning I wake up and thoroughly wash my face with this stuff and pat dry then I apply a light coq10 vitamin c face moisterizer.  This cleanser doesn't "feel" like it's really cleaning my face that well.  I really miss using my previous face wash which was Avolon Organics Vitamin C Renewal Cleansing Gel!!! That stuff was amazing!!! I made a mistake by buying this 1 instead.  Oh well. Just thought I'd give anyone else out there who possibly also has a combination skin type to consider other options 1st unless you also want to experience some break outs!!!

Please note: After recently finding out that they have changed the formula to the old face wash that I recommended above, I cannot make the recommendation to check that one out either.  I wont' be buying it either, since there have been numerous complaints about this "new formula", which is definitely unfortunate!!! I hate it when things like this happen. That was a great product that I will truly miss.

There are other stands considered to be "high end," if nothing else based on their significantly higher prices compared to this one, and if there is a specific design you favor I'd say go for it, but if the classic vertical side by side layout is fine for you then I really can't see spending more on another stand.

This stand has a very even, smooth, attractive finish on it. I was surprised how even and straight the stipling on the neck is. I am hanging a high end razor in it and the stipling looks right at home next to the razor.
The neck screws into the nicely weighted and padded base, and locks up tight and straight. It really couldn't be any straighter or more solid feeling.
Finally, I appreciated that the brush opening is the right size to hold most brushes by the top rim of the handle, it's a small thing but I really preferred it to having the bristles rest against the stand as they did with the previous model I used.
as far as electrics go I guess it is simple to use ,Holds a great charge but my neck never gets shaved always going back and forth until you wind up with a good rash .
I ordered the 4 Pack and received only 2!!!  I need another 2 Pack or 50% refund

Gorgeous insights on the making of this movie abound, though I must confess some disappointment at how little we see of two things: Story insights, and Aisling. I'm a little accustomed to getting a mix of art and emotion in my Art Of books, and this book feels like it focuses entirely on the art and leaves the story behind. I also would've liked to see more than one or two pages of Aisling illustrations.

That said, it's pretty much exactly how it's billed, and it's a really pretty (and really big) book that definitely showcases how gorgeous the movie was. If you want art, you get art.

I'm amazed at the quality and price of this stand. This is my second and I still use the first. it's amazing because a place at the Mall sells the EXACT same stand for $100. It is THE SAME STAND. I go past that store from time to time to just get a reality check. Great buy!
i bought this thinking it was my solution, used it twice and its not made for curves around your bikini area, worst of all it catches!!!! Haven't used it since.

Cheaply made, hard to clean, and easily broken. The beard trimmer attachment is very delicate, the nose hair trimmer is pretty dull, and the foil shaver does absolutely nothing. NOTHING. Won't even trim the peach fuzz off your ears.

Having said that, it does do a decent trimming job if you're careful with it. How happy you are with your purchase depends on what you pay for it, and the price here seems to fluctuate wildly. I paid twenty dollars in 2011; now they're asking more than fifty. For anything under twenty-five bucks, it's worth it. More than that, look elsewhere.
Very obvious whitening of the teeth but as soon as you stop using the trays, your teeth go back to the way they used to look

I am very disappointed in this product for many reasons. The quality is like that of a child's toy; very cheap plastic.  Adjusting the trimmer is difficult and not smooth.  The blades seem dull and do not trim tightly at bikini line.  Hair is missed when using and/or not cut.  The blades to the trimmer heat up very quickly and become hot.  I'm not sure where the high reviews came from for this product. In comparison to another one I had (that lasted about 7 years) it's terrible.  Don't waste your money on this.
I am a licensed esthetician and wanted to try a new organic line.  I have very dry skin and although the smell was wonderful, it did not hydrate nearly enough for me.
A beautiful stand and a must have.  However it does not fit the Gillette Proshield line of shavers properly.  The product finishing is first class.

It's ok but didn't like cream wax that came with would prefer honey wax and cloth in place of muslin. Can feel fax come through muslin often. And the he powder vs the other supplies such as after lotion I could do without!

We bought this little guy as a gift for our son and it's a beautiful and useful razor stand that sits on our bathroom counter as an attractive element on display. It's easy to keep clean and polished and it stands very sturdily. Thanks to Perfecto.

This was a waste of money for me.  The product title "shaper and trimmer" is very accurate: if you're looking for a closer actual shave and not just a length trimmer, this isn't the product for you.  I've thrown it out.

The stand does its job perfectly.  It is holding my Semogue 830 & Muhle R41 w/ a weber bulldog handle.  The razor can rest either by the head or the handle.  As indicated in the instructions, the stand may become loose during shipping.  I simply used a philip's head screwdriver to tighten it back up & all is great.

A nightmare. First of all, it stinks. I selected medium brown and got dark brown. Here's the worst part: my hairline receded one inch after this first use. Where I had hair right above my forehead, I now have baby wisps too fine to even move to one side. I can't believe what I'm looking at. I looked at the reviews to see if others reported hair loss from this product. Indeed there are others. My hair is thin to begin with so this is all the more upsetting for me. Right now, I have to hope that the hair will regrow where it fell out;  I'm afraid it removed it permanently. From the reviews, it apparently doesn't do anything good "permanently." I heard about people using hair products that caused their hair to fall out. I never considered that trying a "natural" and "organic" product would put me at risk. I'm ready to go back to toxic products that at least leave my hair intact and looking nice. I never heard of anyone getting scalp cancer, has anyone? So, I now have black hair that's coming out as I touch it and I have a bald spot at the hairline.  My worst hair coloring experience.
Looks good
The only problem I have with this blush is the high cost.
Great! My brother loved it as his bday gift

OK. Let's just say that I'm looking for the perfect cut, without going to the barber shop.  The Norelco T980 is good, but, it doesn't completely live up to the claims on the product details.  Yes, it does have a turbo button that acts like a facial hair trimmer NOS booster.  However, the blades don't seem to make a perfect cut.  Even after spending considerable time, I still have the wild hair or two left that requires special attention.  The vacuum, unlike how it is described, does NOT pick up all of the hair being cut.  In fact, you'll find your sink littered with remains after even the briefest of jobs.  All of this said, I've used a few other trimmers in the past and this is one of the best.  One more thing, the device feels light (and a bit cheap).

This stand is perfect for displaying my new Viking razor and brush VIKINGS BLADE Luxury Badger Brush, Heavy Swedish Alloy Base + Obsidian Acrylic, 100% Pure Raw Manliness,VIKINGS BLADE The Chieftain Safety Razor + 5 Swedish Platinum Super Blades, Heavy Duty, 100% Pure Raw Manliness It is sturdy, the chrome finish is really clean and crisp, and it comes ready to use. I'd been using bent coat hanger to hang my old brush, but after upgrading to my new one I knew I had to have a real stand. This is a great value for your money, would certainly recommend. I didn't receive any discount or incentive for this review, just believe in letting others know what I think since I rely heavily on reviews to make my own purchases.

Edited 5/13/2016:

I've used this product for years and it worked great with longer bristles.  It always had a tendency for the bristles to get brittle due to the heat of the curling iron,, and then the bristles break off very easily.  The last two I purchased, the bristles starting breaking off within a month of usage.  It used to take several months of use for this to happen.  The plastic you are using on the bristles is defective.  Please remedy this.

They recently shortened the bristles and it makes it easy to burn your hand because of this.  Please make the bristles longer.  Also, they bristles become weak due to heat and start to break.  Please make the bristles out of better material.

To Helen of Troy:  If you could make it get hotter, and make it heat up quickly, and make the bristles longer like they were before, and make the bristles last longer before getting brittle and breaking off , I would give it 5 stars.
Man these blades are terrible. Take my advice, get Derbys.

My opinion is no-it-again models with cream dispenser. I sent it back for a full refund (60 days money back guarantee!).

When you fully dismount the head (kept in position with 2 very small clips on the side) you never will be able to firmly fix again in the original position. Try to install the tools for sideburns and then to re-install the head block, you will see! (The sideburns tools is not in the rear of the razor as usual in the Norelco/Philips, because there is the cream dispenser instead. You have every time -really only one, because I will never do it again- to dismount the heads block and install a strange tools).

Also, it is heavy and bigger than the past models (About 5 years ago models). The plastic and general building feel cheaper rather than the past.

To be honest, I have to say that it shave very well. But I think it is not enough for $119,99 at the time of writing!!!
Groomer works fine. One full charge of the battery lasts for several shaves.
awesome product
Hook for brush not large enough, but I use it any ways.

The power and trimming of this razor is fine. My issue is with the plastic cover that holds in your beard trimmings. Mine falls off easy, spilling the trimmings over the floor. Also the trimmings jam in the narrow vacuum slot. If you do something like take off the cover and bang out the razor over a trashcan, you will lose the filter in the trash can. I have adapted by trimming with my finger holding the cover on, and banging it out while holding onto the filter.

I find that the smallest setting--#1--does not give a real stubble shave. After about five-days without shaving, the trimmer would not cut anything when set at #1. The only way I can get a closer shave is to take the head attachment off and shave with the blade exposed, but this can result, and has resulted, in bald spots where I've tipped the blade too close to my face. This also defeats the vacuum function.
Just what I was looking for. Simple, well made and there is a slight upturn at the end of each hook that keeps your razor and brush in place.
This build the brick and razor perfectly and miss great on the counter

I was kind of excited (and a bit scared) to try this on for the first time but it seems like it wasn't worth the $55... When I had it on, I got less reaction from people than when I was not wearing it. Now, I understand that many people stare/look at me already, without the cologne on, but I wanted to see if the "science" in this actually worked. As a man who believes more in science, I had high hopes for this product.

I did not like the scent enough to make it my favorite cologne--the smell was leaning more towards a cheap perfume than a costly cologne. It doesn't smell bad enough for me not to wear, I just don't prefer it over other colognes. I am going to go back to my old cologne, John Varvatos, but for now, I am going to switch day-to-day from my old cologne to this cologne.

My friend, who is a girl, told me that it turned her off (which is a good thing since I am aiming towards men). So, maybe the cologne does work but it just isn't not capable with me. Therefore, I cannot say that it didn't work because it obviously did something to my friend but I am not going to say that it did work since I received less reaction from people (reason for the three stars).

I will be experimenting with this more, maybe mix it with Abercombie and Fitch's "Wood" cologne (since it doesn't have a great smell). But overall, it might be better just to wear your own "unique" cologne (or perfume, as I read that one of the reviewers is a girl) so that when you do find someone, they'll be able to connect you to your sent.

If you wanted to know, the scent did not change with time when I applied it to my skin, which is usually a good thing. (I know many sprays do, that's why people who work in the cosmetic sections always spray these stuff on your hand.)
Formula is different.  Doesn't work like it used to.  :-(
Looks great, feels solid, works well, size fits in the medicine cabinet.  Thanks.
I love my double-edged razor but leaving it on the counter was problematic during the midday shave. This nice throwback frees my cramped counter so that nothing plummets during the ritual.

I have had my Norelco T770 trimmer for a bit over three years, and now it will no longer hold a charge. Worse, the NiCad rechargeable battery pack CANNOT be replaced !!! Norelco obviously wants us to buy a new shaver and throw out the old one, even though it still works. This is "eco-unfriendly" and deliberate waste at it's corporate WORST !!! Do yourself and the environment  favor, and buy from a company that has the decency to make a product with replaceable batteries. I will NEVER buy Norelco again !

So solid, and really nice looking. There's a little felt bottom that makes it solid and won't scratch surfaces. Fits most badger brushes and safety razors, very solidly. Highly recommend.

Why do they call this 'orgasm'? Because all you see are sparkles??? ugh.

I am very pale, and have auburn/reddish hair. This color SHOULD in theory look pretty spiffy on me, but I can't get past the fact that it looks like a GLITTERBOMB exploded on my face. What the ..>?!?!?!?!? And easy to overdo? Yes indeed! This blush is very very silky and soft; use a light hand. You can always add more but woe be to anyone who overapplies it. You'll look like a feverish clown!

For us (ahem) older ladies, try the Deep Throat. Pretty much the same color, without the glitty garbage all over every pore on your face!

UPDATE: I have the Orgasm/Laguna duo (reviews and photos and comparisons to other products coming soon) and it has been sitting ever since my horrifying discovery out in daylight, that there were glitter bits on my face from using the Orgasm blush. I have since discovered---your brush makes a LOT of difference. I switched to a very fluffy Real Techniques brush instead of my usual blush brush; it deposited gentle color and the glitter was very iffy. (As in, you couldn't really see obvious glitter but if you were verycloselikethis you could see tiny bits) I have revised my review a little bit. Still giving the advice that it's easy to overapply and, this color is sure not for everyone, but I don't want to shoot it with a silver bullet any more. If your skin has any tendency towards redness at all, I implore you to do a test run with this before you count on it looking good for any important (or public) event! I practically have to get microscopic amounts of this on the brush or it's too much for me, and does nothing positive to enhance my complexion. Pretend it's poisonous if you put on more than three nanospecks of it, that will help :-)
Several months after purchase, this still looks great, functions as it should.
