Im going to keep this short. This pomade does not work for me, the experience was terrible. I was working on my hair for 30 min this morning because this Pomade was too heavy and it flattened my hair. After seeing that I was going to be late I grudgingly left for work. I used about a quarter size glob of it, I put my index finger in and stuck it in about half a nail deep and scooped it up. The consistence is like uh...hot glue I guess. I had to really rub it in my hands to get it to melt enough to apply. I applied it on a towel dried hair. It made most of my hair flat, and some little spikes that formed around my cowlick did not stay down. I do have to say it held very very well. But its over kill in my opinion. Heres a example, today I went to cardio kickboxing class and sweated like a mule. I came out of there with my hair still the same looking. All that sweat did nothing to phase my hairdo. Now all of this stuff is forgivable, what really did it in for me is how hard this stuff is to wash out. I know you all hear of how bad Murray's is to wash but let me tell you exactly how bad it is. The internet downplays it in a joking manner, I am not amused. I washed my hair 5 times in the shower with 2 Shampoo's scrubbing and massaging vigorously; to no avail. So I took my soap bar and tried that, did not work. I then tried conditioner thinking maybe it would soften my hair but that didn't work either. After towel drying my hair, I can still sculpt it, like if I just applied hair spray. I am not sure why anyone would want a product that is so bloody hard to remove I don't look forward to putting my greasy waxy hair on my pillow. What is worse the Murrays that DID wash out ended up on my face, so even after washing my face 2 times with a scrub I still have a waxy layer on my cheek and forehead area.

So in conclusion, yeah this stuff is not for me. I think I might try Vitali's or Groom&Clean next as they are water based and easier to wash out. I give it 3 stars because the product works. What everyone says is true this stuff is second only to Gorilla Glue. Its just not for me, if I rated on personal experience I would give it a 1 star. I plan on giving the remaining Murray's to a co worker as a gag joke. If I am going to have this crud in my hair for a week I might as well have someone to share my agony with.

I am a longtime fan of Badedas and was so pleased to find it reasonably priced on amazon almost 3 years ago.  I have continued to order pretty regularly and after running out of my last bottle, I placed an order for another as usual.

However, imagine my disappointment tonight after sliding into the thick bubbles that my bath water wasn't the fresh green Badedas color. What's up with that?

Poured a little out of the bottle into my hand and instead of the weird yellow-green, it came out a clear blue-green.

The scent fades too once it's in the water. Where it used to fill my entire bathroom and bedroom with it's lovely alpine fresh scent, it's now just a pale shadow of the Badedas I fell in love with all those years ago.

My first through was that I got a fake. After a quick internet search, I found out that Unilever changed the formula. I am so completely heartbroken and will not be ordering Badedas again until they change it back.

do not use if you colored your hair with another product, whether a month or a year prior.  it melts the hair. i had to have it cut from long to short.  i was later told (by the supermarket i shop from) to use it only on natural, uncolored hair that if you have no choice but this product... (they did not recommend this brand)  i don't color my hair often.  when i do, i use loreal.  the only product i use with chemicals in it.  i don't like chemicals, but loreal never caused any problems.  make sure to do a strand test before.  even if i did, i probably wouldn't understand the meaning of the result, because my hair gets a little dry when applying color.  yet now i know...  reading other reviews, do allergy test as well.  i don't recommend Tints of Nature brand.  i will never use any of their products again.

also,
i emailed them about my problem and asked them to reimburse me for the hair cut i had to have because of their product; and more importantly to put a warning on the box saying 'do not use on colored hair' so no one else has this terrible experience.  they played devil's advocate with me to the point where according to them i was making false accusations.  i told them about the personnel at wf market told the company she will not recommend knowing how it damaged her hair after she did hair strand test.  and i asked them to read other reviews on amazon so they can correct their mistake and have loyal, happy customers in the long run.  they told me that i must have had bad hair to begin with -i always got compliments on how soft and shiny my hair was-, and threatened me that i can't post comments on amazon!!  what kind of hair dye messes up hair like this?  i used their product a month after i did my roots and a year after my hair was colored honey-gold blonde at a salon.  the most arrogant and ignorant company i ever had to deal with.  it ended up me asking them not to write me anymore.  they are disturbing.

The Price: I usually buy it at the Giant Eagle Market District store in Robinson (near Pittsburgh, PA) and it is about $5/bar. That being said, free shipping is offered here on this product, but the soap is $8.98/bar. This product may be very effective when used correctly, but I cannot recommend it simply because it is nearly impossible to use correctly. I had previously used a generic store brand and had hoped to achieve better results with these. After the first day, I can tell that the whitening effect is stronger; however, the overall result is probably diminished by the difficulty of usage.

Some tips I learned the hard way:

-Don't believe that you can just throw them on and do something else. I spent the entire time they were on in front of the mirror adjusting and dealing with saliva. Paper towel is almost a necessity. I can't help but think that those who just quickly apply them and do other things will end up with uneven results.

-Don't rip the pouches open, use scissors. Ripping them will pull on the backing, and wrinkle up the strips before you can use them.

-Immediately after placing the strip, wipe your fingers off before adjusting the strips. Adjusting could take a while, and your fingertips will turn white from the gel.

I really think Crest could do a better job of making these strips easy to use. Some rigidity to the strips would do wonders. The backing should be a different material and the strips should be precut, something more like bandages would be nice. Also, why not make the lower strips as wide as the top? The material is there, they just cut a smaller strip out...

I may end up with whiter teeth, but next time I'm using the old-fashioned tray and gel.

Original review from 3/14/13: I did not have high expectations when I purchased this. I just wanted a cream that moisturizes and wasn't too expensive. I'm in my late 20s and started noticing my skin was beginning to get a little droopy, losing elasticity, about a year ago. In addition, I have a few fine lines that I was not happy with! I'd been using anti-wrinkle creams with and without retinyl for a while, but nothing made any improvement. I tried Loreal Revitalift, Neutragena Healthy skin, Eucerin Q10, Nivea Visage, etc, with no change. I've been using this cream for about 2 months now and I definitely notice a subtle change in my skin. My cheeks are not nearly as saggy as they were and the bags under my eyes have slightly diminished as well. My fine lines have not changed.

I use it twice a day, after I shower and before I go to bed. I don't use it in the morning as I prefer to use a lotion with SPF during the day. Like I said, this cream won't worked miracles (I doubt any lotion will). But for the price, and compared to all the other much more expensive products I have used, this one is the best. My skin looks youthful, even toned, and my breakouts are not affected by the cream (which was an issue with Nivea). I don't give 5 stars often, but I could not find anything negative about this cream. If I had to choose something, I would say that the smell is a little off putting, almost floral, but not terrible.

Don't use this product. I used it in Nov 2016 and had a burning sensation. Because the look was so nice I used it again in Jan 2017. I had a severve allergic reaction to PPD. It took a week or so but my head was burning and itching. My eyes swelled, I felt dizzy at work, was weak and get very sick. I stated suspecting the dye but was not sure. Went to my doctor he told me I burnt my scalp. Still couldn't figure out what did it. I went back to Natural Grocers where I bought the product and they had no clue, no education. My mother researched the product and PPD is used in products that claim they are organic. It is a dangerous chemical. It broke down my immune system and burnt my hair follicles. Within a month I am bald. I went from nice thick hair to close to 75% bald and still shedding. It's close to 2 months and my scalp still burns. My hair slowly  fell out and then came out in clumps in the shower. We started researching. PPD is a petroleum and use in oil and gas. To make tires... look it up, it falls under several chemical names.

This stand is just perfect. It looks great, and the construction is solid, but not it's uncomfortably heavy to lift. It's balanced, so that if you have a heavy safety razor on the one side (like my Merkur 34C, for example), and no brush on the other, the stand is perfectly stable. (Then again, shaving brushes aren't exactly heavy, are they? They are not. The point is, you don't have to worry about it tipping it over if you don't have a brush yet. And if you don't have a brush yet, you should consider getting one of those next!) But I do in fact store one of my badger-hair brushes on the other side (the German-made one, of course!), and it stays in place pretty well. Much more satisfying than those little plastic stands a lot of brushes come with. The patterned steel in the middle of the stand is also an attractive element, adding visual interest and complementing the similar texture of the razor handle. This purchase was an easy decision to make and I'm very happy with it. It keeps my razor out of the reach of my two young children, and looks great too.

I read reviews on this site and thought I would take a chance. I thought it was the cutest thing ever.  To my dismay, it didn't look as good as it did in the pictures.  I charged it for the required 16 hours and then took it into the shower for the first time.  The noise was a loud buzz that I just hated.  The razor is very tricky.  The middle aluminum makes it difficult to have both razor edges touch the skin.  Anyhow, I tried it.  On my legs (which had hair) it completely missed the hairs.  I stroked it again and again and yet it still missed the hairs.  Dissapointed, I attempted to shave my armpits.  It didn't work there either.  It left me with hair and a painful cut, which never happened with my Intuition.  After this experience, I am returning the razor with its 60-day money back guarantee.  In conclusion, I would recomenned not buying this but if you are just SO currious, buy it like I did and try it out.  Good luck with that.

I just bought this at a local Rite Aid Pharmacy and used it for the first time. I mainly want this because I need a nose, eyebrow and beard trimmer. I have a full beard that I like to keep neatly trimmed and outlined. This did the job nicely and I was all trimmed up in a matter of minutes. I don't know if I'd use this for my hair as it seems a little under powered for that and I agree with some of the other reviewers that the attachments are a bit fragile which is why this gets a four and not a five. However, for the $20 I paid for it, it seems perfect for my needs.

Addendum to my initial review: I've just downgraded my original 4 star to a 3 star review. I'd actually give it maybe a two and a half if I could. Once this was initially charged I didn't have to charge it again for about 3 weeks. This was with just using it every other day or so for basic trimming. Now it will not hold a charge for more than a few minutes and it will not run if plugged into the charger. Still OK for basic trimming but they need to put a better battery in this or enable it to run when plugged in.

Later it feels like my face is super dry and makes my eyebrows and other parts of my face sweat.

This brush stand is exactly what I needed to hold my safety razor and brush. The overall weight of the product is 7.9 ounces or 224 grams. The brackets themselves stand about 5 inches above the top of the platform, which is enough room to hold my Maggard Razors 24mm synthetic brush without problems. The larger of the two brackets (for your brush) is 1 and 1/16 inches across, which may be a bit narrow if your brush's handle doesn't have a particularly narrow portion. The smaller bracket is 1/2 inches across. The outer 3/8 in or so of the brackets are bent upwards to prevent your brush or razor from sliding off accidentally. The foam rubber foot is simply press-fit into the metal base, so it can be easily removed to access the screw that connects the base to the stand.

Overall, it does its job and is easy to keep clean.
It's a great product. Looks nice and fits the dcor of most bathrooms.

Overall, a great purchase.

this trimmer WILL trim hair but not easily. it takes a really long time and a lot of your own added coercion for it to pick up most of your hairs to pull them into its blades. essentially it won't pick them up at all and you're left to figure out on your own how to get them in there. final result: 4/5 stars. required effort: 1/5 stars.

This item was as advertised.

Beautifully crafted little piece. It feels like it's worth much more than the price. Sadly, it doesn't quite fit my "Art of Shaving" brush, so double check before you buy it, but if it fits your brush its basically perfect. I can't imagine what more you'd want out of a shaving stand (it's simple, don't gussy it up!) and this one is so well made and so cheap that it's almost a perfect product.

What a shame, I had a Norleco in the past, I was happy with it because when the battery was dead, you just plug it into the AC outlet, and the motor gets its juice from the wall... This will be my last purchase of a Norelco product.  I wanted to give it zero stars but this wasn't an option.  This moustache trimmer was designed by morons.  The Three Stooges could have done better.  Even the packaging is absurd.  To be more specific I list the following:

1.  Getting through the blister packing was extremely difficult;  I am 6'4", 230 lbs, lift weights and still had to use a sharp knife.  Fort Knox would have been easier to break into.

2.  The instructions are terrible and the print is tiny.

3.  The parts of the trimmer did not fit properly together.

4.  When I tried to make adjustments to the trimmer setting the entire top assembly came flying apart and were not easily reassembled.

5.  The lowest setting really should be shorter.

6.  The rechargeable battery can not be replaced.  (This is actually a blessing in disguise since I will have to throw the entire trimmer away in a relatively short period of time)

I could go on but this device isn't worth my time or money or yours either. Buy a cheaper trimmer from Wahl or someone else or just use a scissors.  This Norelco is a piece of you know what.  It really sucks.

Philips Norelco has no grasp of the concept of customer service.  They are unable to answer a simple question regarding their own product.  They are unwilling to lift a finger to try to find out the answer or assist a customer in any way.  I guess it hasn't dawned on them that their income comes from customers and that customers who are treated rudely will not continue to buy their products.

As for the product itself, it's nothing special. Short corded, half A'd shaver.  Lot's of companies make them, some for less. Some probably even have customer service.

This company is Horrible!!! I buy hundreds of items thru Amazon and I have never had as bad of an experience as what I just did with Direct Super Center. They did not send my complete order of 24 razor blades they only sent 1 package of 8, then their custormer service was total disservice. After weeks of frustration and run around a claim thru Amazon finally got me a full refund. Never buy anything thru Direct Super Center!
Just took longer to get to me then I wanted.

Brush irons are hard to find shopping locally, even in a large metropolitan area. So I was very happy to find this. However, it doesn't grip my hair as well as the ones I've owned in the past. Sometimes strands of my hair get caught in the small space between the barrel and the handle (ow!) and I have to carefully extricate the hair from the iron.
This is a simple but effective product. I have owned it for about a week now and it is a pretty solid stand. I have not had any problems with rust.

As an owner of the previous model without the vacuum, I was looking forward to this new purchase. Bah. This item is heavier, noisier and more inconvenient than its predecessor. And for practically no gain! This shaver catches maybe 10% of the clipped hair with the rest of it flying all over the sink.

Stay away from this model.

Update: I've owned Norelco trimmers in the past, however based on my experience with this particular model, my next trimmer will NOT be a Norelco. The fan which drives the vaccuum rattles against the plastic housing, making a hideous noice while I'm trimming. The vaccuum action is terrible; hairs don't make it down into the receptacle, causing constant blockage. This in turn, scatters hair all over the place, worse than any conventional non-vac trimmer I've ever owned. (And no, my beard is not especially thick either.) I've finally had it with this model. I'm about to order a new trimmer on Amazon. No, it won't be a Norelco.

This is exactly what I was looking for.  It holds the brush by the very butt end so I do not crush the hair fibers when putting it on or taking it off the stand like other models. I agree that it is hard to find this kind of heating iron with the brush teeth, so I ordered this thinking it would be more up to date than the v. old slow-to-heat conair I have.

well, this Helen of Troy heating iron is not any better than the old ones I have.  it is sloooow to heat up !!!  it also feels cheaper than my old versions.  and although it has a plastic cap on the end of the heated part, it seems a little on the skimpy side and I would feel safer and less nervous if the protective cap was more generous.  also, the teeth of the brush are rubbery, bendable...makes it feel even cheaper.

Loved the product minus the sunscreen. Very thick and dry feeling. Have previously used avalon organics face cream with vit c and loved it. Would never buy the one with the suncreen again.

These blades are sharp.  But their sharpness is a rather rough sharpness.  Whereas, in comparison, Astra blades are sharp, but have a very nice smooth sharpness.

Granted, I just switched to DE shaving, so my face may have to become accustomed to this blade.  For now, Astra seems to give me the more comfortable shave.  However, I'll leave Wilkinson on deck and give them a go, from time to time, to see if my face has warmed up to them.

I'll be sure to update this review if the Wilkinson blade's performance has improved.
I was pleasantly surprised with the quality.  I'm only using it to hold a Merkur razor right now, but it stands up just fine even without the brush.
Love this item. It's base heavy so it won't tip over  . Good quality and brings class to my bathroom sink.
I purchased this product as a gift. The product is as described and a good quality.
I thought it was a bargain price, but it actually cost more than if I had bought it locally.

I got this on sale for a pretty good price back in 2007.

Part of the appeal was that it was, loosely, 'Air Force blue'. I'm a blade guy, when I can help it, but sometimes that isn't an option. Like those times when you're truly pinched for time in the morning or your schedule is so hectic you just can't fit a good blade shave in. There are definitely times during Wing Training Assemblies, given the duties I'm usually assigned, that that's the case.

Is this a substitute for a blade? No, not really. It's a substitute for not having shaved at all. That's considered unacceptable in uniform. This won't give you a really clean shave, but with it at least you did shave, whereas if all you had was a blade you'd sometimes have to skip it and hope no one important notices!

I've never replaced the cutter heads. Part of it is that I just never used this enough to worry about the prescribed interval. Thus, four years later, they're not worn out yet. However, Norelco HQ55+ replacements have disappeared from local retailers shelves where I live, so I'd have to order a set from a national retailer if I wanted to do so. In any case, the new heads cost as much or more than I paid for this thing in the first place, which was just shy of $30.

The trimmer works well enough. The cord stays put. The batteries haven't died yet - no batteries, no problem! This is a concern if you're getting it as a backup instead of regular use. It could sit most of the time for three or four years, you use it a handful of times, then the Ni-Cad or whatever rechargeable batteries your shaver uses die and you get to trashcan it just as if you'd used it daily. Not much value there, is there? This isn't exactly silent, but the noise level is tolerable.

You get what you pay for, friends!
It's a must for the guy that uses a safety razor. Besides, your brush will last ages with its hairs down. I love it.
Mostly pretty nice and worth the buy, The angle of the grips are a bit off for a person with big hands, but still nice to use as a workout tool or stress release.

I have been using Norelco for over 30 years and was surprised that the quality of the shave is so poor from previous shavers. Perhaps they should rethink making them in China. This will be the last Norelco that I ever purchase.

I could not give these as gifts, even though they were purchased for some of my family. I would not order for this company again. The soap holder/scrubbers are made so as the soap will fall out. Very unhappy with product!

The product seems solid and looks great.  Arrived on time and well packaged so no complaints at all.
stylish and sturdy what more can you ask for!
Product has started to corrode on top where I hang my brush. Haven't had it long either. I'm looking to buy a stainless steel version next and round file this one.

I was really excited to see this product because I have been looking for a large barrel curling brush for quite some time.  The price seemed fair, and the reviews were quite good.

When I got the product, I noticed that it looked and felt pretty cheap and flimsy - but I still gave this product the benefit of the doubt.  Unfortunately even after allowing it to heat for 10 minutes, I found it was barely hot enough to even begin to curl my hair.  I have very fine hair, and it does usually curl quite easily, but not with this product.  I had to run it through my hair a number of times and finally had to hold it for 20+ seconds to get any kind of 'bend' to my hair.  If I had an hour or so to curl my hair every morning I might rate this product as 'okay', because it does give volume to my hair, but I don't think I should have to repeatedly curl the same section of hair to get any kind of result.

I also noticed (as have some other buyers mentioned) that this curling brush does have a tendency to grab hairs and slice them off before you have the opportunity to save them.  Perhaps I will use this product for slicing lunch meat rather than curling my hair as it seems to be more effective for that purpose, and the cost for me to send it back doesn't make it worth the refund.  Oh well, at least I tried it.
Smelled great when it arrived in packaging. Used in shower once and smelled great. Second shower use I notice no patchouli scent at all.

I've only been using the product for about a week and I've seen no difference, but it could be too early to tell.  But the smell is not good and I almost hate putting it on my skin.  I have liked all the other NSC items I have ordered (beta glucan, digestive enzymes) but I will not order this again.
Worked perfect....Great purchase!!!!

I liked the performance of the razor but the consumables price make it a poor buy. Also the way the razor fits into the charging base is very awkward. The main problem with my razor is that the charging base only lasted two months and died. Without the charging base the razor is useless. Went online to find a charging base and could not find one.
it last for a while but some parts stop working.

I think the wording is deceiving, saying 5 cartriges instead of saying 5 blades gives a buyer the incorrect impression.  I would not have bought that product if I had known I was  getting only 5 blades for that price.

Don't be fooled by the claims that you can use this as a shampoo.  It felt like any other bar soap used as "shampoo," and I had to wash my hair three times to get rid of most of the waxy feeling.  It took several days for my hair to recover.  It was disgusting.

My brief experience with the T770 was similar to Mr. Ginsberg's. I bought it yesterday at Wal*Mart, charged it last night, and today while trying to adjust the trimming height (before using it for the first time) it came apart and I cannot get it back together. The problem is with the mechanism that raises and lowers the cutting head to adjust the cutting height. A small narrow strip of plastic slides up and down in a track to adjust the cutting height when the adjustment ring is turned. If this piece of plastic comes out of the track then it requires special tools and/or knowledge to get it back in.

I bought the T770 to replace a T765 for which I had lost the charger. The cutting height adjustment mechanism on the T765 is more robustly designed and looks like it would not be susceptible to being easily removed or dislodged.

Norelco took a step backward when they replaced the T765 with the T770.

It looks like ordering a replacement charger for my T765 will be worth the trouble after all.

The product details says five cartridges so I figured I would receive five cartridges (twenty five blades) from this company. I got one cartridge (five blades). But this company will get to keep it's $3.41 because I have to pay the return postage which I won't do.

UPDATE: After I wrote the above review I got an e-mail saying someone had made a mistake. The e-mail asked if I wanted them to send me the other four cartridges (the ones that they were suppose to send me in originally in the add). I said of course!!! I received them in less than a week.
Holds both my razor and my brush slightly above the counter as advertised. Very pretty.

This is the worst curling iron I've ever used. It doesn't get hot... At all!! I literally had it plugged in for 15 minutes on high and could still grab the barrel - it was luke warm at best! Since it was so cheap I won't bother returning but I expected better from Helen of Troy

My merkur safety razor fit perfectly, but my art of shaving brush took a little effort until the outer clearcoat wore off a little.

Advice shake out excessive water from brush & razor to avoid water droplets building up water marks on stand finish. I also use rubbing alcohol on razor before storing to increase razor longevity.
A fine product that exceeded expectations. Functional and very sturdy.

I really wish that it had an automatic shut-off for the times that I forget to un-plug it.  It is slower to heat up than my other products like this and only has two heat settings, but otherwise it works well.

It worked well at first l but the top metal that moves on the top broke after 7 or so times using it, and now it's useless. That makes this as good as the drug store razor/trimmers but more expensive. So disappointing!

I have to start this review out by saying that there's a possibility that I was expecting a little too much from this product. Possibly because I had never used an electric razor before, I expected this to perform closely to a conventional, non-electric razor. Unfortunately, this actually takes more time and doesn't get as close as a traditional razor.

If you're buying this product to make shaving your body easier, look elsewhere. This will not cut down the time it takes to shave.

Also, I was excited at the possibility of using this for it's trimming capabilities as well. Unfortunately, the trimming that this product has to offer doesn't work very well either. I was had to "comb" over my armpits and pubic hair MANY many times before it actually trimmed it to the desired length. Then, I found that it had actually over-trimmed a piece of my left armpit as well, causing part of it to be bald! Lol, but I have to admit it's kinda funny. I would prefer to have a bald spot on my armpit than a Giant BUSH.

If you're buying this product for its trimming capabilities, look elsewhere. This doesn't do a terrific job at trimming armpit or pubic hair.

Despite the fact that it performed pretty poorly however, I do have to say that I don't regret this purchase (although I think most people who expected it to help them shave faster and trim easier would be disappointed). I have highly sensitive skin, and traditional razors cut too close to the skin, which makes it irritated. This means I have to wait at least a week or two before I can shave again with a traditional razor. So...

If you're buying this product because you think it might be gentler than a traditional razor, I would give it a shot. It worked for me.

Decent price on needed refills compared to other suppliers, but absolutely ridiculous cost for a few oz. of cleaning solution. Good job, Braun. Way to milk your customers for more money.
It only pulled out about one in ten hairs but it still irritated my skin.  The sticky just is not strong enough for coarser hair. May work on face.
I have bought a variety of razors to see which suits my beard the best which is thicker than most. This one ranks about the same as a merkur in terms of sharpness. Was not a comfortable shave.
Awesome stand
It was perfect.
JUST POOR VALUE AND QUALITY. PUT WATER ON YOUR FACE BETTER RESULTS. VERY EXPENSIVE.
These are great too bad they're so expensive
Worked once, then tried the following week to use again and nothing. I replaced the batteries, nothing works it's dead.. :( waste of 30 bucks.
Very nice stand that looks good on the counter top.
Stains the tub, but is a good product.
My Gillette Mach 3 keeps falling out of this stand.  Other razors may be ok.
The larger side is too small to fit any of the brushes i had
Great looking holder ... fits my Viking razor and brush perfect. Great company that looks out for the customer
Doesn't lather much. Not very efficient cleaner as I find I have to scrub to wash away stronger odors. Nonetheless appreciate a good value for a natural product.

This is a decent trimmer, but it doesn't get as close as the Braun mini shaver does. The Braun is excellent, but doesn't last long.

The Panasonic is a good quality trimmer but just doesn't cut it in the bikini area.

I've only had this for a week, so can't speak to longevity.  But it is really pretty and has some density, given its relative cheap price.  Other chrome razor stands can be >$100.  It's is a nice sleek addition to my bathroom.
What can I say?, the product works well, it holds my murker heavy duty double edge razor 34c in place well. With my badger brush for lathering.
Fits all 4 of the shave brushes I have. Holds my Gillette fusion. My safety razor has about the fattest neck of any and fits. Good weight, doesn't tip over.

The first one I bought, I used for several years. Worked well, kept the bits and pieces neat and tidy without ridiculous razor burn. Would have rated it 5 stars without hesitation. So when it finally died, I bought another. This one was purchased about 5 weeks ago. I've used it once, maybe twice. It no longer works. I tried new batteries, made sure it was clean and not clogged. Perhaps its just a bad batch, but am supremely disappointed.
Amazing quality and build. Very impressed by the product.

I ordered 2 boxes or the Braun CCR2 Syncro Shaver System Clean & Renew Refills.  When the shipment arrived, one box was leaking.  I have determined that there is no way to return this item due to shipment requirements.  So there is no recourse be to discard the package and loose the money.

It is not that great. It does not fit my brush handle so it is almost pointless for me. It does fit my razor and and has good bottom weight to it. The bottom weight helps it from falling as much as some lighter products.

There is always a trade-off between sharpness and comfort, and unfortunately these blades didn't work well for me in either category.  Even right after a shower and with good shaving cream, I found going against the grain to be quite uncomfortable.  I really needed to pull the razor through the hairs, which is never good.

Everyone has different preferences when it comes to safety razors, but these really do not hold their edge too long, and they aren't that sharp to begin with.  Sword blades are definitely a notch above Murkers, but I would suggest getting either Kai or Feather blades.  Those will allow you to cut will very little effort, thus reducing irritation.
No issues

As a long time user of the anti wrinkle gel, I gave this a shot. I, now at 42, am breaking out, because Derma E discontinued the gel product. I had used that for over a decade. Now I am being forced to start my own product line...because, although I love looking young, I am not going to do it with acne.
Solid product at a very good price. Stand looks nice and is well put together. Very happy with my purchase.

This creme feels good and has a pleasant scent, but if you have naturally oil-prone skin and you put the creme on in the morning, use it VERY sparingly as it will increase sebum production within hours and leave an oily residue.  In that case, it's best to use the creme sparingly and do so before bed.  Do not reapply in the morning.

Stay youthful!
Didn't realize this is not waterproof. When I opened the battery compartment it was soaked.

Great quality item for a very good price. The stand is more solid then I expected for the price.  The shape of this stand allows me to hang the shaving brush over the soap bowl, I couldn't do that with stand I had gotten with the kit.  This is well worth the money.
Perfect

Deceptive ad!  This stated that it was case of 50 marked as a markdown of 96% off the original price and pictured a counter display of Dermatone.  I was shipped 1 stick.  I guess I should've assumed that anything too good to be true probably is.

My wife and I both can see a noticeable difference after using the product. It won't get them politician/movie star white! For that you will need to pay $600 at a whitening or dentists office. It will take them however a shade or two whiter. Also I had incredibly sensitive teeth and I need to take 3 day breaks in between whitening in order to not have blinding an shooting pain in my teeth. If you have sensitive teeth do not attempt to use the strips multiple times a day or worse, back to back!

I have consistently been using this blush for the past two years. However, the last two trips I've taken, the blush has broken within the compact making it impossible to use afterwards. This is my favorite blush, except I do not want to continually spend my money buying this product again and again as it continues to break the last two times I've traveled. I am very careful with packing, particularly after the first time the blush broke, so there is really no excuse.
It is a solid, well-made product. Non-slip with a heavy base. The chrome finish should protect it from rust
The seller was great and the product was of good quality. My brush handle was to big for the stand. My brush is from The Art Of Shaving.

I always heard a lot about rosewater and how good it is for the hair. I tried this product and didn't notice softer or more manageable curls. My hair just felt the same. I think aloe vera juice is much better than this.
The pump arrived broken because of packing it separately wrapped tightly around the bottle of hand scrub, broke the straw part. The product is great otherwise
Holds brush and razor nicely
went back to my oil of olay total effects.....seems like I saw more wrinkles while using this

These blades suck! I went through two sets of these blades within a year because the screen and the blades got jammed and started to rip away at the screen. I would clean the blades on a regular basis. I feel this is a cheaply made product that is not worth the money. The blades (HQ4+) that this model replaced worked a whole lot better and were reliable and never broke like the HQ55. Don't buy this product!

Got this hoping my eyes might be a little less irritated. They're still irritated so must not be the hand soap.

Just bought a second bottle. The pump is dead on arrival. Had to take pump from my last bottle. No quality control.

I bought this as a gift to add to the quality shaving brush and other shaving products for my son in law.  I selected it among several on the market and examined it carefully after receiving it. It is exactly what I had hoped for, namely, solid chromed metal, enough weight not to be tippy, able to be screwed apart, hopefully rustproof...we'll see...and able to hold the brush and razor purchased separately.  I might have given it 4 stars if I had been able to use it myself.  If my son-in-law likes it, I'll get this one also for myself as I now have a quality brush given to me in a package of creams, etc., but without a stand.  After only a month of enjoying lathering with a brush, I see that it is definitely necessary to have a stand to hang it upside down to allow water not to sit in and on the handle to eventually corrode the handle and the brush hairs at their base.  The brush needs to air dry hanging down. A quality brush deserves a quality stand.
Look nice and it is stable .
I like it but todays razors do not fit in the razor holder, otherwise its fine and good quality.
Product was exactly as advertised, solid and well finished.  Arrived when seller said it would.  Reasonably priced.  What more could you ask?
Fills the needs of holding the brush.
After using the cheap plastic versions, I finally broke down and bought one, then immediately bought a second one for my son.
Very well made and a functional design.

When I first got this bikini shaper it was great! Then about 2 months later it stopped working - boo! I took it apart and cleaned the mechanisms only to have it power down for good. Nice design, great user experience, but poor quality.

I basically like the trim it gives most of my beard, and the vacuum works well. However, there's a plastic guard (I assume related to the vacuum) that makes it difficult to do close work, like trimming the moustache above the lip, or removing fine hairs on the upper cheek or side of the neck that you wouldn't want to shave. So if you get it I would recommend a second device for those areas, or if you have hairy ears or a unibrow.
The husband loves the chrome and how well it complements his Viking razor.

Like many of us folks out there who need to shave it lease once a day, I became extremely tired of dealing with these financially outrageous and environmentally damaging disposable razors, no matter how many dozens of blades they now staked on them.  If anything, the more blades they put on the surface, the more chance of soap and hair getting into the gaps, therefore making of the blades dull  almost immediately.  And perhaps thats the purpose in the first place so that we throw them away quicker!  Therefore like so many others now, I had a great desire to go retro, and like my father, use a classic single blade and razor, as well as stop using equally environmentally disastrous and hard on your skin aerosol shaving soaps, and instead, again like my father, use a brush and soap cup.  While I was purchasing these items I also noticed this neat looking stand which actually makes sense in that you can put your brush on it to keep it dry as well as your razor so you don't have to search for it every morning on your bathroom sink.  There are many choices for this kind of stand.  And it may seem silly to spend so much time researching the best one, but this is something of it literally could last a lifetime.  I remember that since I was a child until I moved from a home my father had the same razor brush and stand as well.  Therefore after careful research on glad I chose this Perfecto Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand.  I ordered it, it arrived quickly, and is beautiful sturdy and extremely functional.  And being stainless steel.  It matches beautifully with my newly bought razor as well.  Simply, this is the one to get

I do like the lashes they stay on well! My issue is that there is like tacky goo stuck to the lashes when I pull them off so I have to pull it off a lot of the lashes which I do not like. Otherwise the lash won't stick
Beautiful product, matches and holds my Braveheart saftey razor and Parker Silvertip Badger brush perfectly.  The holder is nice and heavy, feels very solid.  I'd buy again.
I used to use these blades quite awhile ago.............still the same............but there are better choices now.
Nice stand but disappointed that the brush would not fit.

Poorly designed in that the button to pop the top off is right next to the switch to turn it on and off.  It works okay but the blade doesn't get very close to the skin, so y still have an eighth of an in or so of hair left on the neck after using it.  Better to save the money that would have gone toward this and invest in a better one.
Was not what I expected.  Now it just sits in my cabinet until the Spring when I have a yardsale.

The biggest problem is the battery. The unit cannot be run from outlet power. You must charge the battery and use that for power. This has two problems:
1) if the battery dies mid shave you are stuck looking like an idiot until it charges. This becomes a bigger problem as the battery life declines. It is also a concern if you try to use the device to shave your head.
2) After about 2 years the battery dies and you have a paper weight. An overnight charge currently gives me about 60 seconds of reduced power shaving time. Not good for much. The battery is not designed to be consumer replaceable.

The actual shave was pretty good, for what that is worth. Though the attachments that control length have a lot of "wiggle room." For a consistent length you either need to avoid putting any pressure at all, or make sure you are constantly putting full pressure on. Also, the release button that lets the guard drop all the way to the lowest setting is right in the center of the head. Right where you would want to put your thumb for strong control. It isn't unusable or anything, but once a year or so I usually hit it by mistake and wind up having to shave my whole beard much closer than I wanted to match the swath I just cut out of it.

This hair wand is rather nice in appearance and fairly comfortable to work with, but takes awhile to heat up.  For medium long hair, it works okay, once it has heated up.  It would probably work best for those users who have thin and/or thinning hair as it does not become overly hot.  Nonetheless, it was the only 1" wand of this type on the web.  One has to take whatever is available.  So it is okay, for now.

I bought this a couple years ago (April, 2008), and have been using it ever since, so I can tell you it's lasted pretty well.  I think I've only ran out of charge with it in the shower once.  Once you get the initial trimming done, maintenance doesn't take very long, and so I've never had problems with battery life.  It automatically stops charging when the battery is full, which is nice, though I suppose if you don't use it for a while, the battery could drain even though it's in the charger, plugged in.  The guards are nice, and I like that the head has a trimmer pointing both directions, and the guards fit facing either way.

As I'm fairly hairy, I'm disappointed by how often I have to rinse it out while shaving.  I generally have to take the guard off each time I rinse, and the guard goes on easily, but is kind of tough to get off, so it's a pain having to do that every minute or two.  A lot of times, when I pull the guard off, I feel like it's going to break because it's so hard to pull off.  I end up pulling the foil out, accidentally, too fairly often.  It doesn't hurt anything, but it's a hassle.  I don't expect not to have to rinse/clean it while using it, but having to take the guards off so frequently is really annoying.  This being my first "manscaping" product, I can't say how it compares to other brands/models, but I'm a little disappointed.  It's not bad for the price, though.
If I could give this zero stars I would.  The product has changed since the last time I purchased it.  I will never buy this again.  I am very disappointed in the change that was made.

I bought a Braun foil shaver and purchased the 4-pack of the Clean & Charge cartridges. I also purchased a Panasonic foil razor which did a much better job. When I went to try to return these unopened cartridges,, I was informed that they were non-returnable. Hazardous materials. So BE AWARE: THESE ARE NOT RETURNABLE. I requested a refund, which I was given. But no way would I have ordered these if I had know that they would not be returnable.
The bottle is broken therefore the water is leaking out. I did not pay $8 for a broken bottle and no rosewater.
Works great for holding a normal size brush and razor! Been looking for quite awhile, and am glad I went with this one. Thanks!
The razor side of the stand is a bit 'small'.  It's functional.
I received the wrong item and had to return it. I can't believe I had to pay postage to return an item that was your mistake

This clipper has some design flaws that make it a poor choice for trimming.  My main complaint is that is has 7 settings to choose from but the settings are adjustable by a dial ring on the handle and it is easy to set the trimmer on one setting but have it slip to another setting while trimming giving an uneven cut and closer trim than was desired.  This trimmer needs to have a setting lock or the dial in a different location than right where you grip it.

I actually bought this product at walgreens because I was desperate after my bridge came out and I couldn't get the dentist's office to call back.  It tastes ok, but it was almost too dry to even scoop out of the bottle.  Once I get it in the bridge it was not at all pliable.  I couldn't even get the bridge to fit again with this inside.  It was also quite painful on my sensitive teeth where the bridge was fitted.  I would say you are better off using nothing at all than trying this crap!

Very happy with this purchase. Stand is solid and weights enough that tipping over is not a problem. Unfortunately my brush won't fit at the base of the handle. However it fits snuggly at the base of the bristles without any damage to the bristles.
A good purchase. It is well worth the price. Looks good on my sink
Solid construction, good fit and finish.  The razor side just fits my razor.

Item was bought as a Christmas gift.  This is the fourth in the series that I have bought for the person.
She loves Thomas Kinkade.  Will probably buy the others in this series if still available next year.

The cream wax that it came with didn't do my girlfriend any justice with waxing her legs, it takes long to warm up it says 15 mins but it took longer than that , and so as she opened the box the lid for the wax cracked soon as it fell once so all in all its ok but not what she expected

Again this was a Christmas gift to my son.  I hope he will enjoy the
shaver.  His brother has the same model shaver and he enjoys it

Warning*** Don't buy this product unless you are positive that you will be happy with it. The 60day full guarantee is a lie. Amazon gave me a very hard time returning this when my son was unhappy with the shave,and I was within the 60 days,  and when they did agree, after numerous attempts through email, they deducted 20% and are only refunding me $84 out of the $109. I understand not getting back the shipping, but when they say satisfaction guaranteed, I expect the full purchase price back. This was a truly awful experience with Amazon.

The razor blades that I had ordered arrived within a week of ordering. But the shipping costs almost matched the actual items that I had purchased (5 sets of 8 blades). That wouldn't be an issue if I hadn't have shipped them regular delivery and the package wasn't shipped from Brooklyn-less than 10 miles from my house.
Worked out great I have natural curly hair and like the iron to relax the curl.
It couldn't shave smoothly, and once left my skin bleeding...The batteries were used up after only three times. Don't buy
Stand was what I expected and arrived when it was suppose tp.
not what i thought it was... i was looking for something more like a curling iron. It's okay for touch ups, but not for wet or nappy hair... hair must be blown out and straighten before hand.

I am pleased that this does exactly what it is supposed to do...and my shaver is always in tip-top condition being cleaned with this solution automatically.  That said, I really find it COMPLETELY unnecessary for Braun to require you to buy an entire new plastic pack to go with every refill.  I would be far more satisfied cleaning out the old one and refilling it with new solution from a simple canister. I suppose the problem here is that this solution isn't the most environmentally friendly stuff ever...and while I'm all for destroying the world one tossed plastic pack at a time and such...I find it illogical and irritating to be getting charged for all this extra packaging every single time.  I wouldn't mind the environmentalists getting uppity about this and demanding an improved solution and/or packaging scenario even if it inconveniences me for a few years of legal battles and then research...but I'd really like to see more thought put into this (as opposed to the technically legal, yet astoundingly stupid, means this represents).  I would rather pay the same price for something representing a higher order of thought even if the solution and materials cost me more than this plastic-packaged monstrosity.
It is okay. It heats well, but I would give it an average rating. You get what you pay for, so personally, I am going to use mine as a travel iron.
Nice product. Heavy and gets the job done.
Works perfectly and delivered very fast

It says that this product is waterproof. When I went to use this product a second time, it was completely corroded where the batteries were and did not work.
Now, it is too late to return the item and I am either stuck cleaning the corrosion and replacing the batteries hoping the product will work or throwing it out.
Very disappointed.
If you're face is wet it doesn't work.

It does not take up much space on the counter and its construction is solid. There is ample room for both the brush and razor. It is a much bettter Buy than similar products I looked at that were much more expensive
I have used this brand before and liked it. However the product arrived damaged and unusable.
You have to take off the trim guard in order to get close. It's seems a bit overpriced for what it does. Panasonic has better trimmer products that are worth the money.
This pulls and causes ingrown hairs.  Absolutely would not recommend.
Hard to clean
Doesn't hold a charge after 1 month.  Doesn't work well plugged in.  Already been replaced.

I ordered this item but ShaverOutlet shipped me another model replacement head.  They claim it is the same thing, but it isn't.  They said they'd send me a refund and I'm waiting.  They wouldn't pay shipping costs either.
It is good for trimming and controlling a beard.  Wish it had a bigger shaving head, still using straight blades to shave stubble.
This is a terrific product. I enjoy having a holder for my shaving brush and for my razor. I have different types of razors and they all fit in the slot. Well built. Sturdy.
these did not seem to work as well for my husband as the one's we'd ordered before, they pulled at his wiskers...
need to go slow or it pulls the hairs

Reformulated crap!!!  Very watered down and doesnt last more than 20 minutes.  Its nothing like the original from years ago. I still have an original bottle with some in it, and i remember it well, and also have an old bottle to compare to.  Even an old glass bottle smells better than the new bottle i have now.  Very watered down and reformulated crap just like all the classics they ruined.  The musk smells ok, but i don't know what that one used to smell like.
Buy Brut instead.  Although its also reforulated, it will still last over 3 hours or more and smells similar to the old scent.
Even Old Spice has been ruined.
I used a few times and it didn't seem to do any better adding volume than the mouse I already use at less than half the cost.  I don't feel it was worth over $20.
Looks nice and holds shaving brush but does not hold razor
It does nothing.  Wasted money and effort.

In general a very nice razor stand. The razor side could be another 0.5 cm deeper to allow my razor to sit without hanging off the edge. Perhaps my razor has a larger diameter handle. Otherwise very nice and the right size.

If you're in the market for a body hair groomer, skip this item over and spend $15-20 more on the BG2030.  The reviews for that item claim that it turns a half hour job with the BG2020 into a five minute job using the BG2030.  I bought the BG2020 and was so displeased with how long it took to get the job done that I did more research and found the BG2030.

If you're in no rush, though, this is a pretty decent product.  I was very cautious at first because nobody likes getting nicked or cut down there but after my second use I decided to be a bit more cavalier and still didn't get nicked.  Don't lose the AC adapter for it, though, because it's hard to find a replacement and when you do it's about $20 so you might as well buy another unit so that you have a back up groomer.

One of my caps came off and I bought this product and FOLLOWED THE DIRECTIONS EXACTLY.  It did not work.  After an hour the cap came right off.  A friend of mine suggested I use Fixodent as a temporary measure.  I called Fixodent and they said it was okay to use on all dental appliances.  I bought the travel size of Fixodent for $1.99.  I put a very small drop in my cap to try it.  The cap stayed on for 3 days then came loose so I used another small drop and was good for another 3 days.  I'll use Fixodent until my dentist can see me. For caps forget Dentemp ($5) for a temporary fix and get the Fixodent ($2), it works.

Ok, this is strong stuff.  I had no idea. That's my bad. It gets a three star rating because I thinks it's way to $$$ considering all of the other products out there that do the same thing. Otherwise, if your new to this product, do not use it every day! Good God, you'll regret that. It will burn your skin off, you will peel like a dragon, and there will be way more deep set wrinkles for about a week. No kidding. I had to place chamomile and tea tree essential oil along with aloe on my face on night. Ouch.

So, it does take off skin layers. Does it erase wrinkles. Maybe by 20%. But that's it, tops. I prefer the glycol acid over this.
Also, it is a heavy cream. I don't like the feel of it. Too heavy. I only put it on at night...and very sparingly now. I'll stick with it until I run out. If I see a huge improvement when all is said and done, I will surely report back!  :)

Using for approx 3 months.
Well, I'd say it is "perfecto". Looks sharp, sturdy and holds my brush a razor well.
These are some of the least sharp not smooth blades I have ever used.

It took 12 days for the cartridges to arrive. I have been using a Mach3 since they were released. These blades look like Mach3 blades and come in a box for Mach3 replacement blades, but they must be counterfeit. I had to put my old blade back on my razor until I can go buy replacements at the local drugstore. Save your money, a single blade razor is far better than what is being peddled here

This item arrived quickly and seems to work, but it is not HQ 55 plus as described,and there are 3 replacement heads instead of 6. This is really another part number which is at least $6 cheaper. Now it is used and cannot be returned. Amazon should not allow this kind of deception.
Nice handy little stand.
Very well packaged and is a great stand.  Fits my razor and brush with no problems.  Feels very sturdy with a heavy base so it will not topple over.

The previous trimmer I had was a Phillips one and trimmed hair pretty close to the skin. I have to really loved this Panasonic trimmer. I like my bikini trim to be closer than what this blade gave me, at it's closest blade depth. It also heats up pretty quick. I guess, if you're in a hurry and just need a little shaping, this work, but a little disappointed.

Not worth buying, if hoping for a nice lingering smell.  I ordered this spray and the Jr Watkins Lavender Body Oil Mist, only because I was a little leery about what would actually have natural lavender in it. What my grievance is, is that Vienna's body mist does not really have a strong smell, in fact it  fades away almost as soon as you spray it.  I tested both sprays on each arm, and my husband said he could not smell anything on the arm that I sprayed with Vienna's.

This is an excellent stand.  Not only does it look lovely on the counter but it helps keep the razor and brush in good condition and it's more hygienic than leaving them on the counter or in a drawer.  I'm very happy with this purchase.
Just as described. Seems to be good quality. Has some weight to it. Shipping was very fast.
I got this to complete set of shaving stuffs for my husband and it is really great! Shipped as expected.

This is cheap.  The end cap is so loose that the sections of bristles keep sliding out.  I'm going to try to figure something out to fix it because it's not worth replacing it, the new one will be the same way.

I've had it for under a year and it's holding up decent, but one of the parts for the smaller clipper attachment broke, so I can't adjust the size for that part now. Overall, the precision of the blades is decent, but for if you're looking for a system with all the basic tools as a decent price, this will do.
Works fine. There isn't anything excellent or terrible about this shaver.
Its a very nice stand looks well made and sturdy it has some weight to it. appears it will last a very long time.
Sparse amount of bristles.

You might be thinking... well there are some good and some bad reviews about this item. ANd like I did, you might be thinking, well how bad can it be? I'm sure it's not as bad as they say. Think again! Those people were telling the truth. This razor gave me the WORST shave of my life! No kidding! And it's loud, and doesn't charge properly, or even fit in its charger properly so while you think it's charging it's actually not and have to constantly press it back in. I feel robbed of my $15! just spend that money on something else. trust me, you'd be a lot happier! uggh.. i don't know how to convince you anymore, except: Seriously people!! DON"T BUY IT!

Somewhat disappointed the stand did not fit the brush I have.  Seems to need something of a specific type of brush to set in the cradle right.  It's a good product aside from this though.  Was able to switch my travelling and home brush and make it work.

Let me lead off by saying I had to return this product, but it wasn't because of defect, but the size of my shaving brush.

For the price this stand is very nice. Feels solid. Chrome finish is bright and consistent. The brush opening was just too small for my shave brush. And it lacked a curve to keep the brush from falling out.

I have a chrome pommel, parker brush and without a little curve to the brush prongs our a wider split between them, my brush wouldn't sit in the holder.

For those with a smaller, less base heavy brush, this stand should function flawlessly.  I changed from a three star to a four simply because of the customer service. They contacted me and were extremely nice. The product seems very solid and I only wish it would work for my brush.

I had high hopes for this product but its just not working for me. I've been working at taking a more natural approach to my life on all aspects and trying to eliminate harmful chemicals from my beauty routine. I read so much awesome stuff about this brand of soap and I was excited to try it. I have very long hair, down to the small of my back, and this made everything but my roots waxy. Now I imagine it's partly due to the fact my roots and a few inches after are "virgin hair" so the majority of my hair has been dyed at some point and exposed to parabens, silicone and what not. I imagine if I had shorter hair I could manage to get through the transitional phase I've read about or if my hair was "virgin" that this product would work well. But that's not my case. I've given it only about 10 days and 3 washes of a chance but I just can't continue trying without feeling like a complete dirtball. I'm going to have to try something else.... However thus far it has worked fantastic on my toddlers hair but it did burn her eyes.

I've had a Braun 8585 for years...got this to replace the cutter and foil. I found the shave quality decreased and the blades started pulling whiskers. Also I was nicked more often. I finally replaced the cutter and foil on my 8585 with this: Braun Series 3 Combi 30B Foil and Cutter Replacement Pack (Formerly 4700,7000). It fits perfectly and gives me an excellent shave. No more pulling, no nicks, and a closer shave. Definitely the way to renew an 8000-series razor. Avoid this foil and cutterblock!

Nice sharp razors, with consistent quality in the pack I received. However as is common with shaving, I found these particular blades don't suit me well, despite their nice clean cut, I found them a little too aggressive with my Edwin Jagger. That said, your mileage may vary depending on your skin and razor combination.

Robert Sabuda's cards are always magical and this one could be a "smile in an envelope".  I send these as get well cards, and they never fail to get the most enthusiastic responses-- the last person I sent one to said, this is like getting a "smile in an envelope" -- Thanks for carrying these wonderful cards.  They will brighten any gloomy day and cheer up even the grumpiest patients!
It was just what I needed!
Not very powerful. Ends up pulling hairs instead of trimming them.
not bad
Works in a pinch but you'll never get a good shave with these electric razors. It saves me from razor burn though and going to all the trouble or getting the cream and water and all that jazz.

The word TAPE must nt mean the same to everyone. When I received this product it came as dental "floss" (thin string) not dental "TAPE" (thicker string) to get the wide spaces in between teeth. I won't purchase again, in fact I will pass this one on to a family member.

I suppose you get what you pay for.  For $40, it's not bad, but if it were any more expensive, I would have been disappointed.

A few problems:
* The packaging looks smart but trying to open the thing requires a lot of work.  The plastic wrapping is almost impossible to cut through and it is very sharp.  I don't know why they packaged it this way.
* It comes with a flimsy rubber hook type thing if you want to hang it up on a wall.  Kind of useless.
* The plastic combs are difficult to get off.
* Regular clippers work better to get the bulk off, and then the Bodygroom comes in handy to "fine tune" what the clippers don't cut.

Overall, it is an acceptable product, but for an all-over body trim, it would take a long time using this product because it is not "heavy-duty" and you would be constantly cleaning it.  Use regular hair clippers and this product comes in handy to handle whatever the clippers don't do well.  It has an overall cheap feel to it, but it looks good and performs satisfactorily for the price.

About six months after purchase, I've just finished ripping it open in order to remove the batteries and dispose of it responsibly.  But it was garbage even before it died.  It's still under warranty, but I dislike it sufficiently that I won't bother to try for a replacement.

The mechanism for setting the clip depth readjusts itself under even mild pressure - the only reason that it didn't die of being thrown across the bathroom after removing half my mustache is that I don't have that much energy in the morning.

The vacuum compartment cover falls off frequently during use, which means in practice, it's just saving all those little messes to make one big one the moment you drop your guard.

It's large, heavy, awkward to use, and notably ugly - cosmetically over-designed, completely with little blinkie lights to pointlessly nag you about the status of its obsolete NiCAD battery.

If you're a hormonally precocious eight-year-old or own an SUV, it's sure to appeal.

I purchased this to replace by gum stimulator, because I could not get replacement tips for it. I was thrilled with both the flosser and the pick. They work very well. Now after about 3 months this one is doing the same thing! Sometimes when you press the button it doesn't run. I have to tap it on the countertop or shake it to get it started. I don't want to buy a new one every three months.

PS. I soak the flosser and the pick in antiseptic mouthwash overnight so I can reuse them for a week or more.

The trimmer itself works fine. It feels pretty sturdy and seems to run fine. It holds a charge really well, I don't have to charge it very often.

I called Norelco @ 1-800-243-3050 and they sent me a free replacement, which they noted they would only do once. The other ones do the job, but again, they feel sort of cheap.

If you're on a budget, then go ahead and pick this trimmer up, but be really careful with the attachments. But if you have a few extra bucks, I might shop around for a razor that is higher quality and that comes with nicer attachments.

As a waxing professional I've used many different waxing machines. This one isn't the best but it also isn't the worst. Overall the kit comes with everything a novice/professional would need to get started. I like that there are sample sizes of products I wouldn't have purchased, but enjoyed trying out in the set. When I bought this waxing kit I bought different gigi wax in addition to this set because I'm not a fan of their soft wax. Its decent for a beginners kit but not something I prefer using on my clients. Here's what I liked about the kit:: It has everything you need in the box to get started right away. There are several cardboard collars to keep the wax from dripping on your warmer. It heats up the wax very quickly and the price for the kit is reasonable. What I didn't like about the kit:: The warmer has a very poor gauge when it comes to heating up the wax. It either doesn't heat up or its burning hot so I have to turn the wax heater off before I use it on my clients otherwise I risk burning them. Probably not the best kit for a novice since they may end up burning themselves, but if you want a good deal and are experienced with wax machines this is not a bad deal. Definitely investing in a better more accurate heating element but this works in the mean time.

I have used this size and brand of curling iron for many, many years.  I usually keep a spare on hand "just in case."  The new one I received is, well, new.  It gets really, really HOT quite fast--I burned my hands several times (slow learner).  The barrel seems smaller than 1 inch, and my hair gets curlier, but this may be due to the HOT factor.  The "teeth" are shorter, but I have relatively short hair so no problem; using this curling iron on longer hair may be difficult.  The rows of teeth tend to slide off the barrel--luckily, I've been able to retrieve them off the floor before the dog does.  So far.  The one change from the older model is the sequential switch:  off, low, high instead of low, off, high.  I will continue to buy this curling iron, but I would consider other brands if available.

I bought this thinking it would be easier to use than a manual flosser, do a better job, or both. Was I disappointed. The floss is too loose to snap between your teeth, you have to constantly press the button to activate the motion (no true on/off switch), and it is too short. You have to have your hand in your mouth to use it on molars. I tried several times thinking I would eventually get the hang of it. Finally I gave up and went back to my manual Reach flosser. It's a much better product for half the price. Reach Access Daily Flosser Family Pack With 14 Refill Heads - 1 Each

I have the 770, but this issue would be common to all of these trimmers.  Shaves okay.  Problem:  eco-unfriendly.  Battery contains toxic materials and company does little to assure that people eventually dispose of it properly--Norelco  officially tells you somewhere in the literature to take the trimmer to a recycling place, but by the time anyone's ready to replace the thing they won't know where the literature is telling them that, and besides, Norelco doesn't really provide any support for doing so:  no address or contact info, even.  Since there's little help or encouragement taking care of the battery responsibly, I'm sure most people don't.  Thanks Norelco!  :(  Still, i'm unaware of better alternatives and would be interested to learn of any.

I used this product on my face and neck for a few days and noticed two things.  The skin on my neck got very itchy and felt rough to the touch.  My facial skin did not get itchy, but it became very, very rough feeling.  My skin is generally not sensitive/allergic.  This morning I read an article in Delicious Living which listed ingredients to avoid in personal care products.  One of these ingredients was retinyl palmitate ... the name of this product?  Viamin A Retinyl Palmitate.  I guess my body's reaction to this product is not surprising.  I'm tossing this product out.  A clue should have been the price. This trimmer does work well for, as they say, anything below the neck.  *Almost*.  You'll definitely need to be very careful trimming your (ahem) more sensitive areas.  While its true that the shaving blades are completely protected from nicking your skin, the vibrating trimmers pointing straight out on either side of the foil can make this shaver even more dangerous than a normal one.  I think a good solution would have to involve getting those trimmers out of harm's way, or maybe only putting a trimmer on one side of the foil, not both.

Aside from being primed for grabbing and cutting through some very sensitive skin, the trimmers on both sides also mean no matter where you want to shave with the foil, you're leading with a trimmer.  This limits what you can and can't do.  If you'd like to, for instance, shave bare all the way to the edge of your naughty bits, the trimmer's position means you'll be forced to trim the hair on part of your thigh as well.

Good idea for a product, but clearly not as well-tested as it could have been.  3 stars for the quality construction and its ability for most areas, -2 for the dangerous design in the most important spots.

I'm giving this three stars because for one thing, the seller was ultimately fast, the transaction was a breeze, and because I genuinely love Manic Panic colors and this is *exactly* the same as buying the regular MP dye!

Which is also the biggest problem: it's EXACTLY like using the regular Manic Panic, only several dollars more! I go through ridiculous lengths to ensure the longevity of my red hair ... before dying I use special PH balance shampoo & refrain from conditioning to ensure the dye gets soaked up by the pores as much as possible. I rinse it out with white vinegar, and then with COLD water. To maintain I use special color safe shampoos/conditioners AND mix a little dye in them to keep the color longer, & I always rinse with cold water and blow dry to seal the color in when I'm done, then use the cool setting when I'm done to close the follicle. I also only wash my hair every few days and on the off days I use dry shampoo. All of these things combined usually makes the dye last longer than normal. So when the advertisement said it would last 30% longer, I thought it would give me a couple more weeks. But it didn't. 4 Wks later and I'm already re-dying.

I owned an older model Remington three head shaver for about 2 years before I bought this one.  It always gave me a close shave without having to make multiple passes or contort my face.
But I dropped it a few times and cracked the plastic head for it which I couldn't find a replacement for.  So I upgraded and paid over $100 for what I thought was a quality electric shaver.
I am very disappointed with this shaver.  I can get a close shave with it, but I have to go over the same spot 5 to 6 times to get it smooth even after the so called "two week" waiting period.  I just purchased the new Remington Titanium self cleaning model as I feel it will work much better, judged by the performance of my older Remington. This ad is deceiving. You think you are buying the original high quality Braun 8000 series replacement when you are actually buying the more recent lower quality Braun Series 5 Combi 51s.

They show you a picture of the original. Tell you there are only 9 left. At the bottom they let you know there is a replacement blade but it's deceivingly unclear that you are actually buying the replacement and not the original.

I cancelled an order with another vendor for the replacement because I wanted the original.  I actually paid $5 more.  Bad seller.

In my case the replacement works in my razor. It's just not the product I thought I was buying.
Did not get hot enough for my thick hair. I have it to my mother who has a little but finer hair and it works ok.

This unit seems ok at first, if a bit underpowered compared to similar battery operated trimmers. Even when fully charged, the blades move too slowly, and it doesn't do an effective job of trimming. With the blade guard removed, it is so bulky that it can't easily be used to trim in tight spots around the nose or ears.

The unit uses NiCd cell which is sealed within the housing. NiCd, or the Nickel Cadmium cell, has among the lowest life of rechargeable batteries, and the worst recharge characteristics for infrequent use. A 3 year life for this product is either luck or fiction; this trimmer may die sooner than you may expect. My Norelco T770 died after about a year and a half.

Once the cell loses its ability to take a charge, you can toss it. There is no cost-effective or easy way to replace the cell inside the unit.

Bottom line: don't waste your money. Buy a trimmer that can cut, and is not meant to be disposable.

The Norelco Bodygroom is most effective when you do not use the 3 attachments that come with it.  My wife loves it for personal grooming.  I will keep using the Norelco Bodygroom to compliment my existing Conair groomer.  Would I buy it again?  Yes, because my wife loves it!

This provided additional irritation as I must circulate the floating heads over and over again in many areas.  The other features of easy cleaning and nice design are great, but I really want a good shave to go with it.  If it gets better, I will try to access this review to update it.

After about 4 minutes of wearing the strips, I experienced the WORST PAIN I EVER FELT IN MY LIFE.  It felt as it the pain was coming from inside my bottom teeth, and I actually was nauseated from the pain, that's how severe it was.  I immediately ripped off the strips and rinsed out my mouth, and now I'm PETRIFIED to attempt using them again.  Does anyone know if this is normal?  Please email me and let me know why this happened!! (thethugyone@aol.com).

Resulting in much more frequent dressing changes, and the need for a soothing skin cream, like Balmex.  Also, perhaps more importantly, another brand I have used provides more padding for overall protection, and comfort.  I will probably continue to find use for these, just be aware of what you're getting. Lastly, made in China, if that matters to you.

The directions are unclear and there is no dropper so you'd have to buy separately or guess the amount you're putting it into your polish.

Just ok. It works fine in the moment, but the polish seems to get thick again when I need it the next time (within a week or so). I've used other brands which use different chemicals that make the polish thinner for a much longer time. It doesn't have any negative effects on the polish as far as I've noticed, the polish goes on smoothly and the dry time isn't changed.
I expected the trays to cover all of my teeth. However, they only cover the front half of the teeth and do not extend to the back teeth. They do whiten,  just not ALL of your teeth.

Okay, this product works as intended, but is not a long-term solution! Go buy a toothbrush that whitens your teeth: it is far better for your teeth in the long-run than applying chemical treatments to your teeth, and it is much more uniform in the manner it whitens (even when you have applied these strips in the best possible way).  I give it three stars not because it isn't a good product for what it is supposed to do, but because it is not the right kind of solution!  This is like buying a lawnmower when you can just buy grass that doesn't grow any taller than you want it, too...  Anyway, it did whiten my teeth but not as much or as fast as the whitening toothbrush (which whitens just from brushing rather than from chemicals).
