I tested this out today, and it does indeed work.  However, the 'wax' is so sticky that as soon as it dries it will not come off your skin no matter how many showers you take.  Now, I understand waxing is supposed to be messy, but I knocked off two points mainly because this 'all purpose kit' did not come with the second most important ingredient...the wax removal oil.  What were they thinking not including a means of actually removing the wax?  That is a pretty big deal when you're finished and you have these huge pink globs all over your body and fingers, and no amount of soap will take it off.  Another reviewer on here saved me by mentioning cooking oil will take it off...vegetable oil most definitely did and now I know what a chicken feels like right before you throw it in the frying pan.  Thanks a lot, Gigi.

If you buy this kit, buy whatever wax remover the company sells as well, or trust me, you will be sorry.  Other than that, the kit is attractive, the instructions detailed and there are a nice assortment of lotions/creams/etc.  The 'Sure Clean' countertop remover is supposed to take wax off of floors, tables, wherever you accidentally blotched it.  Using this, it did not work well at all (I had to get a tooth brush out and scrub for about 5 minutes to get a few blotches off my sink)...I'm sure paint thinner would have worked better.

Overall, not a bad product for the price.

These Wilkie's seem "Thicker" than any other blade I've tried. Hold one of these and a Feather or Astra or any other blade in one hand and gently bend it with the other and the thicker Wilkinson Sword blade will not bend as easily as the thinner blades. I'm not sure exactly how that translates into shaving but what I notice is that while it "Feels Safer" while shaving, it won't shave as close or get the troublesome, hard to shave spots nearly as well as the more flexible blades. Perhaps it's not a "Flex vs less Flex" concept but instead a simple "Thick Blade" thing. Like shaving with a KaBar vs a razor blade. The metal is just too thick to shave close.

I ordered this after reading the reviews which stated that this product was appropriate for sensitive skin. I have rosacea that's usually under control. The first night I applied this cream, I felt a bit of a tingle and noticed some redness. At the second application the next night, my skin turned bright red after just 2 minutes. Had to wash it off. Don't know exactly what caused the irritation but I can say that the lavender smell is quite strong. Not a good fit for me, unfortunately.

I was seduced by the new features offered by this shaver thinking it was worth it but found out after one week using it that it is not.

I've been using philips-Norelco electric shavers for the past 10 years, every couple of years I change for an updated new model, so I'm not new to these shavers.

This time I went for the new top of the line and I'm dissapointed: my old 8000 series was smoother, with the 9190 I get a sligly faster shave (but not closer) but irritates my skin (thanks to the three ring shaving heads, faster shave but uncortable one). LCD is terrible (contrary to old model) can't see info unless I turn on the razon. Pros: Motor is quieter, design is pretty, better handling, but thats is the least important stuff, I'm getting hurt with this shaver!.

I am thinking of either returning it or replacing heads with the 8 series model (too bad after spending $200!) or keep suffering a couple of weeks more to see if my face gets used to the new blades (cause sometimes you really need to as manual indicates).

So my advice: not worth the upgrade from a recent model and not well suited for sensitive skins (although always better than manual razors).

I bought this for my husband, and he loves it.  It is very sturdy, doesn't tip over easily, and keeps his razor and brush of the countertop.

he's used it for about a year and still going.  good one.  I got this and the blades and set etc as a xmas gift.  my husband never shaved this method before but i thought it was classy and fun.  HE LOVES IT!  It is a great manly type of gift and he say's he'll never go back to shaving the other way again.  Yay me!

We purchased (2) of the Helen of Troy 1514 Brush Irons on November 29, 2017.
One of them stopped working on February 19, 2018 and would not heat up on Low or Hi.  We've had previous models that lasted for years, still heated up and were used till all the bristles broke off. We will see how the second one performs as I am cautiously optomistic
Amazons return time frame ended on January 29, 2018 and so we are still looking for information on the manufacturers warranty. Hopefully it will be honored.

I keep buying these because other dog owners I know keep stealing them after I show them how well it works.  I keep one on my dogs collar so it's always where she is, and at least one spare with my travel supplies.

I haven't had used an electric shaver in many years, and this model was a pleasant surprise in some ways: It is extremely silent, and easy to take care of (you can put it in running water w/no problem). The shave is also very close, which is basically what I was looking for.

A big downside for me is that the shaver doesnt work as well in tricky places (e.g., neck), so I need to shave the same area many times and the skin gets a bit irritated. Overall a good buy, but technology is not there yet for me to completely discard my manual razor.
These are good for beginners to start with but had a tendency to tug more than feathers do, but do get the job done.
Very pretty cover with a lot of room to write important appointments. Tired of relying on my cell.

It comes in handy when necessary although it's not very user friendly. Can be quite messy and you'll still need to use your tweezer afterwards. The wax is also hard to clean off your skin. Baby oil works best when removing the wax residue from your skin.
Looks and feels sturdy and built to last. Does not wobble at all. Rubber on base means it won't scratch my counter
You would think these would be great blades but I seem to get razor burn from these where some cheap personas seem to shave more times and seem sharper.
Very nice, exactly as described. highly recommend.
This product has great battery life and is fairly quiet when running.  However, it sometimes requires two or three rounds before I have a complete shave.
Not waterproof like advertised and broke after 5 months
Not a great bikini shaver
great product

For the low price, this really isn't a bad set of grooming tools.  The battery life is pretty good out of the box, and all of the tools work well at first.  Just don't expect this to last very long.  After a few months, it has gotten to the point where a full charge barely gets me through 30 seconds of trimming my beard.  And the comb attachments for the trimmer are junk.  One of them broke within a few weeks, and the other one is very "jabby" on my neck if I don't angle the trimmer just right.  I won't be buying this unit again, and I wouldn't consider it a good gift by any means.  But considering how cheap it was I can't complain too much.
These work fine, but after these ran out, I started making my own with straight rubbing alcohol.  My husband says they work fine and cost about $0.25 per refill.  There are lots of how-tos online.
It works but gives me break outs every single day, after using it for almost 2 months.

This product is good...but SO MESSY AND STICKY! Whenever I use it, it gets everywhere! Maybe it's because I'm new at this, but I can't seem to pull off all of the hair either. Maybe buying different papers would work instead of the ones provided? I kind of wish I wouldn't have bought this... I'd rather pay the 30 bucks at the salon every time!
This product is great and i love shaving like my father did in the 1950's.

IF I wanted a really clean smooth shave I would use a razor...but this shaver is ok...but just ok for everyday use.

I shave twice a day, morning and evening...and its really necceary for me with this shaver. It just doesnt get down as close as my older shaver which was also a norelco...but overall I am satisfied with it.

Used N8: Im a natural blond and my hair is light blond, but because of a lot of sun my adges were brighter then roots and I wanted just to color roots and left 10m for the rest of the hair. I end up with dark blond color!! Ugly and very disappointed!!!
N10 - was such a nice color! It wasn't in the store and I bought N8. Now I have an ugly color and have to do something ASAP

The T970 from NORELCO is the sorriest trimmer i ever ran across.

The writeup of this product gets one to think that this is a real great product, but it turns out to be a "dog".

When I turned it on, after charging the battery, I thought the thing would fall appart in my hands.  It does not hold a charge and all around is not what I expected for NORELCO to put on the market.

 recommed not to purchase this thing.
Holds your brush and razor with an attractive stainless steel finish.

Very difficult to find this size in beauty supply stores. Wife thinks this model will be perfect for her. Very good price, has
already been used and works fine, seems to be good quality at a very good price!!
A little to heavy for me. I have to learn the right amount to use or it weighs my hair down. But I like the smell and I can use it if I don't put too much on

When I lost my Norelco 6885XL (which is Norelco's equivalent top-of-the-line razor), I bought this.  I shouldn't have.  The shave that I get from the Braun is much less smooth than from the Norelco (although a regular safety razor like a Mach 3 beats them both by a decent margin, regardless of what the ads say).  This one has a fancy electronic cleaning system that requires buying a cleaning cartridge every month or so.  It still doesn't seem to be any cleaner than the Norelco, which just needs to be washed.  I find myself having to shave the same areas of my face over and over and over to get a semi-reasonable shave.  Trust me, just buy the 6885XL instead, and you most likely won't be disappointed.  It's a much better razor.
It's very thick...

This is super easy to use and comes with everything you need but honestly I never use it, I make such a mess and get the wax everywhere (which doesn't come off) it's a hassle to find a safe place to use this product. I line my bathroom and sink with cut trashbags or paper bags all to wax my upper lip and chin and eventually I decided it's not worth the time, the fuss and the mess and it mostly stays hidden in my closet.

I love Cocoa Butter but this is the first time I'm trying the solid and I really didn't like it as much. I prefer the crme. It just didn't work for me but that don't necessary mean that it won't work for you. The scent of the solid is a lot stronger than the crme and I prefer a mild scent. I would recommend it to people that like a stronger scent. I find the Queen Helene nicer than other brands that I have tried.
Looks good but doesn't fit my shaving brush..
I find I have to push far more than I should before I get alcohol out of here.  Also it's not so easy on the eyes.  Might buy another type if I had to do it all different.

Doesn't work as good as professional trimmers, but doesn't cost as much either.  As far as what it's designed to do, I don't think the turbo feature works any better than normal mode.  It still drops a lot of hair in my sink in either mode.  I have to go over an area a few times to remove all the hair no matter which mode I'm using.  All in all, the T980 works OK but not great.
Wonderful. Great price, solid built, esthetically appealing and mostly practical. Highly recommended!!!

Like most of the other reviews it seems to bean improvement over older electric razors I used in the past. Unfortunately, no matter what I try it still seems to miss getting the hair on your neck and under the corner of your job. This is a good buy if you want something to clean up quickly during the week but still do a weekly shave with a straight razor...at least that is what I am doing now.
Functional and looks great.
Product was exactly as advertised, quality is excellent, item arrived earlier than expected. Thanks again!

I guess I should have considered another review of this item, since I expected the trademark bay rum fragrance and it clearly doesn't have that. The ingredients are first-rate but it just needs a different label so you know what you get. The best surprise was the little sample of frankincense-myrrh soap -- that one I would definitely buy. The sandalwood sample was ok but that and the main feature here are going to be regifted. The scent of the "Bay Rum & Spice" is very close to an old duck decoy soap we got from Avon once -- just a little too strong for my tastes. So you might want to get this one as a gift but not if he (or she) is expecting bay rum. Also the makers should make a separate soap which is authentic bay rum and then the other spices can go into "Wood Spice." Now you have a fuller holiday selection!

I've used a number of beard trimmers over the years.  This one is as good as I've experienced.  I bought this one for my father who is in his eighties.  The various height adjustments are excellent for creative trimming.  The only problem with this unit is a battery with apparent memory.  The instructions offer all the cautions about how and when to recharge.  Failure to abide by the instructions may shorten the battery life or cause it not to recharge...hard to explain to old folks.
The item pictured is the one I wanted but did not receive. I received Avalon wrinkle serum with rose hips. It does not work as well, that is why I didn't give it 5 stars.
This product just does not do the job. The guides are not calibrated correctly and the trimmer took turns being razor sharp to incredibly dull. Not worth the money.
Works well. Gets the job done. Is sturdy, holds my brush and razor perfectly. Looks good too.

I purchased this for my husband not even a year ago and it worked great.  We saved a lot of money on his weekly haircuts by using this.  Only problem is it died on us yesterday.  No given reason.  Never dropped. Never wet. Nothing ever done to compromise the trimmer.  It just stopped working.  I will say, I placed an order for a new one the QT4070.  I hope this one lasts longer...This time, I will keep the box ad the receipts.  One suggestion: be sure to save the box and receipts so you can get it fixed or replaced with whatever warranty they offer.
I like it
Received exactly what it's advertised for. It's nice and feels sturdy, not cheap. Just an FYI..... the battery operated razors don't fit, but the standard razor does (think fusion). Hubby is happy ;)

I received my Perfecto Deluxe Crome Razor Stand about a week ago, and it lives up to it's name. It holds my razor and shaving brush perfectly. It also adds a touch of elegance to my bathroom counter. In my opinion, it can't be rated any less than five stars.

I was due for a new razor and asked my wife for one as a Christmas gift. She purchased the Norelco7180XL at Sears for about $85.00 thinking it was a good quality razor, which it is. (Still made in Holland as another reviewer wrote). It looked great, and I was excited about the water clean up feature. After an overnight charge, I gave it a test run. It was remarkably light and very quiet, it almost seemed to be running too slow to actually work, but it did a good job of removing my stubble. Just one problem -  It seemed to really abrade my face, which was quite irritated afterwards.  I do have sensitive skin, which is why I don't use a standard razor, but I never had this problem with the Braun, or the Remington razors I owned previously.

It states in the users manual that it may take a few weeks to get used to Norelco's patented lift & cut system, but I don't think I would ever get used to the irritation this razor caused. Call me a pansy, but I had to return the razor, and am now in search of a new Braun model with better ergonomics, and a smooth, painless shave. Just wanted to submit this review as a heads up to anyone else who is contemplating this razor, and has sensitive skin.
Holds my razor and brush nicely. Looks good, nice quality.

After several years, the battery won't charge at all, nothing, nada.  The design of the product doesn't allow it to be connected to power in any way and still continue to function.  It was used perhaps once every three months at most.  I've had shavers where the plug connects to the shaver stand or directly to the device itself.  That way, if it isn't charged enought, it can still be operated.  No such option on this product.

PROS: The color is very pretty and (I believe) fairly universal for many skin types.  It applies smoothly.  That's about it for the pros.

CONS: For this price I was expecting something way different in pay-off.  I don't pack my blush on my cheeks, but I like to have some hint of color, but apparently NARS doesn't agree with me.  I have to apply multiple times to see ANY evidence that any blush has been applied.  I use good brushes and do tap the product out before applying, but that is only to ensure even coverage, and is NOT a problem with my other blushes.  The other maaaajor problem with this blush is that it doesn't last.  I don't touch my face a lot, but somehow at the end of the day my cheeks always seem to be bare when I wear this.

I won't be buying this again, and I recommend any Lorac blush over this----amazing pay-off and lasting consistency, plus beautiful colors.
Good sturdy stand, very happy with it. Looks great.

I tried this product on a simple loose cap despite many poor reviews.  I should have paid attention.  This stuff is useless.  I am an engineer with over 40 years of experience, including the use of adhesives.  I followed the preparation and application directions flawlessly.  I even kept pressure on for an hour (very uncomfortable).  The crown fell off immediately after.  Save yourself some grief and a little money and use something else.

Solidly built stand, and an excellent value for the price!

Honestly, I was a bit hesitant to purchase after reading some of the other reviews which mentioned loose parts, etc.  But mine arrived with everything nice and tight and ready to go! And even if things were loose (or somehow become loose) in the future, it doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out how to tighten them.

In my opinion, the name of the item describes the item accurately: Perfecto!
Sturdy stand and it looks nice in the bathroom. The Gillette razor I have been using doesn't fit very well, as it slides out easily.

This stand is exactly what I needed and it should last!  I recently bought Vikings Blades "The Godfather" and the House of Saxon 26mm Badger brush and they both fit this stand perfectly!  I had a Croft and Barlow "kit" that I purchased back in 2010, but it was almost all plastic and my new brush barely fit the stand, so I bought this and I'm glad I did!

Pro:
1. seems like all metal construction
2. Godfather DE Razor and Saxon brush fit nicely
3. Small footprint

Cons:
1. Brush holder too small for Stirling synthetic 26mm brush, but I'm going to try spreading the fingers further apart
2. No issues with the finish, but for the price, if I need to replace in 2022....I'm ok with that!

The lotion is terrific but getting it out of the dispenser can send you to the tool drawer for a hammer and pliers.  Whacking it on the counter (per the manufacturer's guidelines) rarely works.  The dispenser is junk but the company continues to use it!

This was a great razor while it lasted, but a VERY poor purchase overall. I maintained the battery exactly as recommended. But the battery slowly lost the ability to hold a charge and finally failed completely after two years of light use. It won't hold any charge now nor will it work with the AC adapter.
Brush and shaver fit nicely!
I prefer medium golden brown but it was not available.

Great product! I recently got into wet shaving with a double edge safety razor, and wanted something to hold my brush and razor in order to keep them off the bathroom counter. The "Perfecto" stand came up in a search and seeing as how it looked well built and had a very reasonable price, I decided to give it a try. Bottom line...I couldn't be happier. It's well built, looks great and holds my items just as it was intended. I definitely recommend this product. Well done!
Excellent product  Stand is very stable and does what it was designed to do.  Currently using the stand with a Parker Silvertip Badger Bristle shaving brush and a Gillette Mach3 razor.

My Braun 7570 arrived yesterday.  I owned a Braun electric razor many years ago and was disappointed with it, so I quickly went back to shaving with a blade.  I recently decided to give electric razors another chance and following some research, I ended up buying another Braun.  After my first shave, I noticed two things: (1) electric razors seem to have improved over the years in terms of their ability to provide a close shave, but not by much; (2) my Braun "Clean & Charge" unit was broken and will probably have to be replaced.  Apparently some flimsy rubber part inside the shaver receptacle has broken off or was missing in the first place.
You would be best advised to stay away from this razor but if you are determined to buy one, you probably won't find a better price than Amazon.com's.  It certainly lured me in.
Good trimmer for the money. Doesn't cut quit as low as I would have liked. But otherwise good product.

I loved this purchase!!!! Until it broke the right after the first time I used it..... it says it is waterproof, however my batteries were  rusted somehow after I used it ONE time. I would buy again but fear that the same thing will happen. the battery spot is not in a good place.
Shiny, looks just like picture. Falls over quite frequently though
This stand looks good and works good. I would give 5 stars but it did not accommodate my brush without distorting the metal ring at the base of the bristles, however the brush goes in and I am happy.
does a good job of holding shave tools and it looks good doing it.
A
well built
Perfect compliment to my shaving set, it is mandatory to have this.
looks great on the sink. good solid build quality. my parker and semogue brushes both fit .  highly recommend.

The product does numb the spot but it only lasts a short time...maybe like 45 minutes. From reading the reviews for Orabase, I should have went with that one. I bite the inside of my cheeks every now and again so I will def try out Orabase next time.

Update: I'm really bummed because this stopped working after owning it for nine months and using it once every two weeks or so. For the price, this should last much longer than 18-20 uses.

Initial review: I've used a few different trimmers over the years, and this is my favorite. I've been using this for three months now. Please note this is a *trimmer*, not a shaver. Although I suppose you could take the guard off, I wouldn't recommend using this for a full shave. My previous trimmer was rechargeable, but I actually prefer batteries. The charge would frequently last no longer than a few minutes, even when I actually remembered to charge it. My favorite feature of this trimmer is that the pointed tips of the guards are rounded. This may sound like a feature that should be common sense, but other trimmers have been more pointy (and thus, painful). This works great, and I'm very happy with my purchase.

Not as good as the original foil and cutterblock, but then I'm echoing a 1000 or more others who share this experience.  SHAME ON BRAUN for NOT DELIVERING the SAME HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCE to those who (after investing over $200) have the audacity to expect a close, comfortable shave when they dutifully replace cutterblocks and foils and spend a lot of cash for cleaner (which amounts to scented denatured alcohol and mineral oil at 60X the price of the components!!!)

A while ago I purchased the cheapest battery-operated CONAIR trimmer available at Macy's because I was on a trip and I got tired of shaving. I used it for a while after that, and one day, for some mysterious reason, decided I wanted a bit of an upgrade (tired of replacing batteries, mostly). This was not really an upgrade at all. It didn't trim any better. Still gives nicks and cuts. This is bottom-of-the-barrel cheap, and don't imagine otherwise. The trouble is that because it is so so cheap I'm now turned off from upgrading to the more expensive Phillips products, which I probably should have tried in the first place.

This product is a scam!  Not only does it have the consistency of water, but you need a tremendous amount for it to foam, as suggested in the instructions.  I have a shaved head and can see going through this bottle in a week or two at this pace.  To make matters worse, the my short hair was sticking up as if I had been electrocuted!  I'm going to try try this junk one more time and if I experience similar results, I'm going to try to return this trash.  BUYER BEWARE!!!
Fits the  razor and brush perfect

Shaves great but the green indicator light which is supposed to flash when fully charged never flashes. I just have to leave it charging for 12-24 hours and it does seem fully charged by then. But it does shave great.
ok

This stand is very well made and does exactly what it's supposed to do. For whatever reason I thought it would be bigger than it actually is but it's a very good size without taking up a significant amount of counter space. This will likely be the only stand I'll ever need. Seems as through it would fit just about any razor and brush. No complaints whatsoever.

Terrible blades, I mean terrible. Do not waste your time and money. This is not even close to a close shave. For the last  two months I have been trying different blades like Polsilver, Feather, Personna, Astra and Merkur. This one was the worst by far.

I have a Gillette Mach 3 Razor and  it won't stay in the holder.  A double edged razor would.
It is easy to maintain  and looks nice.  Holds the brush fine.

I had hand surgery and this has helped me get back the strength in my hand,thank you. These are a great product !The only qualm i had is that if you have really large hands,these might not be long enough.
Worked well initially, with time (several months) the blades become weak and end up breaking hair rather than cutting

The Oral B Advantage Plus tooth brush has very stiff  bristles and caused a great  deal of pain to my mouth the 2 times I used it.  When I ordered the product through Amazon.com, I thought I ordered soft bristles, but the medium ones were sent to me instead.  Be sure to avoid this product---OUCH.
Not sturdy very wobble.

There is no way that I would call this color light brown on me; it is more of a medium dark brown and has none of the auburn highlights that the picture of the gal on the box has.  The color looks more medium brown ash on me.  While I don't agree with the description of the color, the product went on easily and covered my grey completely.  I'll be interested in the durability of the color.  Every time I color my hair it begins to fade immediately with every wash and I've lose 50% of the color intensity within 4-5 weeks so i'm looking forward to seeing how this product wears.  I had absolutely no burning, irritation or allergic type reaction; the product ingredients seemed quite mild to me.

I bought this product based on the good reviews. However, it just died after only 3 months of infrequent use. I changed the batteries and it didn't work, it's dead. What a waste of money. It also didn't trim completely bare, however it was better than a manual razor as I didn't get those awful red bumps afterwards. But the attachment doesn't even work, I had to take it off whenever I used it as otherwise it didn't get any hairs, and then it would just scratch my skin while it shaved. Avoid!

This is the best shampoo for dry hair and I have been using this plus their citrus conditioners as a leave-in and their avocado conditioner after shampoo.  I have incredibly coarse hair and it's very dry here in the winter - this combo is just what I need.  However, after using this for about 7 months it's too expensive to continue purchasing this.  They only sell in small bottles and even their conditioners come in 16oz as the largest.  Too bad, I emailed John masters and they won't sell in bulk.  I have long hair as well so I use a lot of this shampoo. I'll look for something else now.
Broke the second time I used it.  Panasonic refused to replace it without me paying for return shipping. Amazon was great and replaced it for free though.
Works VERY well for holding my shaving brush.  Cleans up easily.  Quality built and looks great.

The blades sent to me do not fit my razor.  The part number is correct, but the way the circular blades are made they do not fit onto the spindles that project from the razor.  Hence they are unusable.
temp control does not work

When I was younger I used two after shaves: mennen skin bracer and the original aqua velva scent. I bought a bottle of this recently. I was disappointed slightly. It still worked but, they changed the original scent. The original scent was crisp, clean and distinctive. I wish they would have left the original scent alone. It was fine as it was.
WORKS GREAT AND LOOKS CLASSY !!!! GREAT PRICE AND FAST DELIVERY.
Letz talk about DRAMA!!

The product is fine.  The price is not.  These replacement heads cost the same as buying a new Norelco 2100 shaver.

Stop buying Norelco replacement heads until they lower the price.  Buy a new shaver and throw out your old one.  Eventually Norelco will figure it out and lower the price on replacement heads.
Can't stand the smell. I  hardly use it.

I bought this a couple of years ago. It works OK on my beard, but the guard is too big for my mustache and it makes it really uneven. I like being able to shorten both my beard and mustache during the summer. I'm going to replace it with another unit.

This is very slow to heat up and the heat never reaches a high enough temp to do quick curls or styling for my short, fine hair. Got a replacement with multiple heat settings and shorter tines. This one is going in the yard sale box.

This is...I don't know what to say this is...but it really does not remove anything...you have to remove the plastic head to get a close shave....still hoping somebody invent a machine that will give you a close shave but not clean shaven

Over all, this one is great. I purchased it to replace the Lady Remington (which I lost while traveling). However, it does not seem to work as well. After shaving, run your hand UP your leg. This item does not leave you as smooth as a cheap disposable razor and shaving foam/cream. I returned it to the store and repurchased the Lady Remington. Here is the ASIN if you are interested in looking it up here, on Amazon, to see about it.
(ASIN: B00005B6ZG)
However, this Norelco shaver does last without recharging longer than any other I have owned. Yet, that did not matter to me, personally, since when I am not using the razor, it sits in its cradle charging.
Detra Fitch for Huntress Review.
Do not buy.  The prongs on the brush side are so close together that the brush will not fit on the stand.  A waste of money.
It broke in less than 6 months!!!
This product wasn't terribly vibrant. But Ive never had much luck with green dyes.
Just ok, not very impressed.  Too many steps to follow.
Heavy and solid. Perfect for my Merkur "1904" and brush!

Nicely weighted and has a very classy look, much nicer than the plastic stands.  The item shipped fast and came in a box that was perfect for gift giving (this was a Fathers' Day gift).  My husband was very pleased.

I do feel my review would hold more weight in twenty years. That's because I hope to have this product that long or longer. I'd like to think that in my seventys that it will be at Least close to as shiny and no rust spots. As of the here and now? Yup it holds my razor and brush in a sparkling sturdy way. I can be gone all day or sleep all night ,and when I check on my brush and razor their right there hanging out just like I left them. It works great! Almost worry free.

This is the first time I've tried this cream and I'm not understanding the good reviews. Maybe mine is from a defective batch or it somehow went bad. Because of the great reviews, I'm going to exchange for another jar and give it one more try. I'm hoping I'll have good things to report. The jar I have smells like the "scrubbing bubbles" bathroom cleaner, not like lavender. I was afraid to put it on my face at first, but after reading the ingredients I felt my nose must have been tricking me. I began to break out about 4 days into using this on my face. I decided to test my chest and neck next and they broke out too. The breakouts kept up until I had stopped using this product for a few days. Maybe my skin was getting rid of junk that needed to come out of the pores. I can't really say, but I can say it wasn't what I expected. With my usual Avalon cream, breaking out was never an issue. I'm going to go back to that one for now and recommend it to anyone with combination skin Avalon Organics CoQ10 Wrinkle Defense Night Creme, 1.75-Ounce Bottle . The Wrinkle Defense Night Creme is expensive, but one little pump covers my face and upper neck area if slightly damp.
It broke after only a few uses. Seemed to be made of very cheap material. I would not recommend this product.
Solid heavy stand. Quality materials! Worth the money!

In short, if you use the clipper guards, it gets clogged up with hair when dry, or is completely useless when wet. If you take off the guard, it works great wet or dry, and indeed won't nick your most sensitive of areas ;) If you want no hair, get this. If you're looking more for "manscaping" then get some other clippers.
Husband loves this

I have bought T7500 which had bad battery and then T770 which also died after about a year. I have tooth brushes that last years. For some reason norelco batteries have very limited life.

AVOID buying this.
The razor was bought for my son for Christmas. He said that in order to get a close shave he had to push it up against his skin so hard that he got razor burn from it.  We returned the razor.

It is perfect For my brush, doesn't need large space. Fully recomended

Beautiful!
It's nice to find old fashioned quality and this is it. The fit and finish is excellent, it's heavy enough it's completely stable. I'm enjoying it every day.

I gave the Oral-B Complete Advantage Deep Clean, Manual Toothbrush only a 3-star rating because it is not what I had hoped for.  But I can't say that the given description nor the reviews by other users gave specifically the wrong impression. I ordered this because it was said to have a small head. Its head is shorter than some brushes but not thinner. I needed almost a child's brush with a long handle and hadn't found one in the stores. This ordinary brush was appreciated by family members I gifted with each of mine.
Stand looks great and feels very sturdy. Very happy with it.
The teeth on the brush have broken off in spots. Only used a little. The plastic body seem very light and flimsy.
Works fine... but you get maybe 2 or 3 shaves (days) and it needs recharging, again.
I didn't love this. It's ok but I wouldn't buy it again.

IT HAS A GOOD HANDLE GRIP TO IT BUT WORKS NO BETTER THAN A GOOD WOOD HANDLED STEAK KNIFE.

Beautiful chrome stand with solid base. I'm using it with the Escali 100% Badger brush and a Viking Chieftain Safety Razor and both fit perfectly. Mad huge style.  Looks impressive on the bathroom sink
The product did not perform according to the listed Vitamin C, E and A; no difference in skin appearance nor feel.
This cocoa butter is okay but, it doesn't do well for my skin. he next time, I'll get something better.
These wonderful little lashes are perfect. Now I don't have to mess with mascara very much anymore. Thank u ardell.....

Further, you'd have to apply three on the bottom, and three on the top, else only your front teeth are whitened.  Good luck, trying to make that work.

And, they are supposed to work after only a few treatments.  Yeah, right.

Frankly, if you brush your teeth with baking soda like gramma used to do, you'll likely get the same results.  Or, get those little teeth trays, put baking soda in the trays, and take a shower or do something which won't make you swallow much.

T970 is miles away from its predecessor(s) (I also own a T7500 Deluxe) as far as the feature set goes. It boasts a charge level indicator, incorporated vacuum, and fast 15-minute charging time. However, I don't know what was in the mind of the industrial designers who came up with this latest installment from Norelco/Philips other than capitalize on the truck craze that's taken such a powerful hold on us. Indeed, I wish all those miles were for the right reason. Let me explain:

I view the newly added vacuum function adding only marginal benefit to this unit, at the expense of draining battery power fast, noise making, and increased diameter size. With T7500, all one had to do was to charge the trimmer every other 15th use or so, and undo a couple of things to clean it after each use. Also, T7500 was smaller, it fit well in your hand and/or travel pouch, and could be charged at 110V-240V. Now, T970 requires a recharge every 3rd use or so, and it's so much harder to fit in you hand and/or in your travel bag since it has a larger diameter and comes with a power adaptor that works only at 110V. Cleaning T970 is akin to undoing a Matrioshka, the Russian nesting doll.

Thinking more about it, I came to the conclusion that T970 wasn't put together by industrial designers but some marketing types... For these guys I would venture to suggest that they should keep T7500 on the market; it would serve very well the traveller types, whereas its successor would be for stay-at-home folks.

Considering it sells at a discount and it comes with a 60-day return period, I am able to rate it cautiously at 3 stars.

I've used the T6000 (the original trimmer) for 5 years and loved it until the battery crocked.  I've been using it on the wire since, but then decided to upgrade.  My first reaction about the T970:

BAD:

* Plastic is VERY flimsy - it doesn't have that tough look.

* Lots of movable parts, which have very flimsy plastic hinges (I think I'll break them soon)

* Not as compact as the original T6000 (Nape trimmer doesn't extend from inside but is rather a separate attachment)

* AcuVac is junk - it doesn't catch all the hairs but most of them. (The trimmer is very loud because of the AcuVac.)

* The little brush needs to be longer - it doesn't reach some of the parts where hairs stick, like the AcuVac containers bottom leaving me having to blow the hairs out - which land literally all over the place making me wonder why I bothered with the AcuVac in the first place.

* Travel case needs to be more compact a made of tougher nilon, the charger alone is HUGE! T6000 had compartments for the Brush and the wire, snugly fitting together.  I'm afraid the pivoting head on the T790 will break off the first time I put the trimmer into my travel bag.

GOOD

* The pivoting head actually helps in raising hairs to get a more even shave, leaving hair softer (a feature I've lived without for 5 years, and think can go without a little further)

* Charge Indicator is pretty cool.

I bought it because it is the most expensive trimmer on the market, thinking PRICE=QUALITY, boy was I wrong, but with Amazon's special @ $43+change my girlfriend will have something to use to trim her poodle.

I have been using a Norelco 6826XL. I recently bought a Norelco 8140 SpeedXL.

Also, I like the heavier weight of the 6826XL rather that the light weight of the 8140 SpeedXL. I am going to try other razors to find a faster and better shave.

I was initially impressed with this shaver.  The shave was very comfortable and close.  And it rinsed clean!  Or so I thought.  I dilgently rinsed the shaver under the faucet after every shave.  However, after a few weeks, it needed hand cleaning.  I opened the shaver, and cleaned the the heads.  The design of the shaver heads made it virtually impossible to replace them properly.  I finally got the heads in correctly, or so I thought!  The shaver never operated correctly after that.  I struggled for quite a while and could never get it right.  I finally gave up and returned it to Norelco.  Hopefully, my refund will be processed soon.  I purchased the Remington as a replacement.  Its shave is not as comfortable, but it is adequate, and it has its own cleaning system which doesn't require hand cleaning.
This product is all that the description says. It's very sturdy, fits my razor and brush perfectly. The rubberized base makes it sit comfortably on any glass top counter as well.

The base has a foam rubber anti-slip pad that works quite well.  If anything, a little water makes it "stick" via water tension.

The weight is substantial enough this never tips over during use.

Recommended.

I've used several derma-e products over the years, and although some work better for me than others, I've never had a bad reaction to any of them. I have combination skin with some rosacea and no acne. I normally use the Pycnogenol Moisturizing Creme, but it can be a little greasy in the eye area. I liked the idea of something truly oil-free and light. The first couple of days I was pleased with this gel: Just a small amount goes a long way and it is indeed very light. Then I started to notice tiny zits, first on my forehead, then on cheeks and chin, and my rosacea became aggravated. I stopped using the product, and within 36 hours the zits and redness were almost gone. Wish I knew which ingredient to blame for this; unfortunately, all I know is that this gel is bad news for me.

I have been using Avalon Organics CoQ10 for years.  Both the day and night wrinkle defense creams.  To my complete dismay I cannot believe that the product and the packaging has changed so dramatically.  The original product was the best, and now it contains a reformulation that seems to benefit the bottom line of the company and not the customer.  First off, the formula does not contain all the original ingredients that made the product so great in the first place.  They have pulled many of the good things and have replaced them with less expensive ingredients.  The soft and wonderful formula left my skin glowing and now it is more paste-like on my face.  It goes on much more dry, which is not what 30+ skin wants.

Do not let the "more sustainable" fool you.  It is not the same product as before.  The supposed sustained packaging is terrible.  I have had 2 bottles with defective pumps already.  The new formula is much thicker and the supposed great packaging and new pump allows only for a tiny amount to come out.  The last bottle simply had a pump that stopped working after the first few pumps.  I had to use the product by opening the bottle and labor to get some of the product onto the palm of my hand.  I have written to the company about the reformulation and never received one response in return.  They do not seem to care.

In addition, many people do not want the SPF they now add into the product.  It would have been better not to add it at all and let people opt to add this on top, or put out 2 separate formulations.  I am not sure why they took something great and turned it into a mediocre product at best.  In my opinion, look elsewhere, as this is not the great product it once was.

This has been working great at removing upper lip hair. However it doesn't get anything from my bikini. I don't know what I could be doing wrong, and yet it simply just doesn't get the hairs down there. Oh well, at least it works for my face.

These are pretty and solid.  I was slightly disappointed that they weren't the same and of the same quality as the ones I got from Reed and Barton for my wedding 28 years ago... but they also are much less expensive.  A solid buy for the price.

When I used these strips, I found that they were too flimsy, and therefore tended to bend back over themselves, making them difficult to apply.  After they were applied to the teeth, they did not always stay in place and tended to slide around.  Also, it is inconvenient to have to remove the strips, when they have done their work.  For these reasons, I do not consider them to be the best alternative.  A much better alternative is the dissolving whitening strips manufactured and distributed by CVS Pharmacy, Inc.  These strips are less flimsy/ more firm and therefore don't stick onto themselves, they adhere to your teeth far better; AND they dissolve completely in about 5-7 minutes, leaving no messy residue or plastic film to have to discard.  On size strip (larger than Crest's) fits both upper and lower teeth.  The active ingredients are the same as Crest, but the cost is about half the cost of Crest.  Superior to Crest in every way.

Nicely made but my shaving brush will not fit.  I have a Parker badger hair brush and it doesnt fit in this stand.  The brush is too wide to go between the hanger "tines".  This would be a nice stand if it did fit though.

These refills work fine, but they only last 3-4 weeks. This is like buying ink refills for your printer--you end up spending more for the refills than you paid for the razor. My previous Panasonic electric razor could be rinsed off in the sink, but this Braun requires the Clean & Renew system, which is expensive in the long run. Also, it leaves an alcohol smell on the razor that gets on your skin when you use it, so you have to wash your face after shaving. I wish I had just bought another Panasonic that I could wash off in the sink.  That said, these refills do work as advertised.  I just don't like having to use them.

But if you have a heavy beard and/or only shave every couple of days then you will definitely be happier with a more powerful shaver.

I saw a youtube video with a guy shaving with my same Muhle R41 and touting these blades.  I found them to be absolutely unbearable next to the Feathers and the Astras.  In fact, these seemed to provide an exacerbated version of the downsides of each of the other blades.  They were far less sharp than the Astras but somehow far prone to nicking and irritating than the feathers.  To put this in perspective, I can definitely shave with Feathers and avoid nicks/irritation.  I cannot do so with these.  Perhaps I got a bad batch?  I wouldn't rule it out, but with my 100 pack of Astras, I won't feel the need to try other blades again any time soon.  Astra for a daily shave, and Feathers for special occasions, or when I have more time to shave.

I have been using this shaver for about 2 years and I agree with the review "Guess-A-Charge!".

The Bad:
When I received this as a gift I had no idea that shavers were made that didn't work when directly plugging into the power outlet.  I guess it wouldn't be necessary if the shaver held a charge, but even then, what if you forget and you have no charge one morning?  Wouldn't it be nice to know you could just plug it in and have full power??

Back to what I said about holding a charge, mine doesn't.  I get one or two shaves at full power and then another shave at half power..nothing like listening to your razor die while you are trying to shave.  It never held a good charge from day 1.

After maybe a year the head assembly started falling apart when I took the top off to clean it out..nothing funner than fishing through the bathroom garbage for shaver parts, thanks Norelco!

The Good:
For those couple of shaves I may or may not get at full power I am happy, it cuts close and relatively quick.

The Sideburn/beard trimmer is nice.

Overall this product has let me down big time..I guess I was spoiled by my old Philishave that was built like a tank, held a charge and could be used with the cord.  Did I mention it worked for 10 years!  This is proof they don't build em like that anymore.

UPDATE: it finally died after 4 years and now I can buy something better. The recharge time was always awful and didn't last, I will not miss this product.

The product has performed much better than I expected however, I think the size of the package is somewhat deceptive. Stating the amount in the container in grams is not a reasonable way to describe the amount of product you receive. I doubt if one person in ten could tell you how many grams there are in an ounce. The best measurement is the 8+ repairs but that's easy to miss. You've fufilled your legal obligation but not your moral one. If you could put the "8+ repairs" in a box and not run the type over two different parts of the background, it would be easier to notice. Frankly,I doubt that there are actually 8+ repairs in the container. I could not make the same repair that I did another seven times. It would be more like four to five and my problem was re-cementing a cap. There is always a small amount of waste when you make a repair like this and you can't re-use the waste. After one aborted attempt, I successfully made the repair and it has been several weeks since I re-cemented the cap. I eat and brush afterwards and have experienced no subsequent problems.

I was looking for a dual-purpose rose water and I have realized, after the fact, that what I really need is a true hydrosol. Since I read the consistently high ratings for this brand at the time, though, and the budget friendly price, I decided to go with this one. I received it yesterday and used it last night in my face cleaning routine. The smell is okay. Maybe I just don't like roses as much as the next person. It was by no means offensive, but I personally wouldn't want to wear a perfume that smelled like this. I transferred this into a fine-mist spray bottle and spritzed it on after cleaning my face and neck and applying Hyaluronic Acid, and before my moisturizer. Since I have several steps in fighting the melasma, wrinkles, and adult acne, my face gets dry by the time I'm ready to put on my moisturizer. I will definitely continue to use it, as it does seem to keep the dryness at bay while I go through my routine. It is refreshing on the skin and I had no negative reaction to it.
For the dual-purpose part: I had Lasik eye surgery 10 years ago and I've been suffering from extremely dry eyes for about two years. I wanted something without all the synthetic ingredients that all the OTC drops have. Many people have commented that rose water drops are very good for dry eyes. Turns out, this rose water is just distilled water with rose essential oil added. I need to do some further research, but I don't think this is going to work. For skin moisturizing purposes, though, it's fits the bill.

Just finished using GIGI cream wax. The warmer and the applicators are good. The wax is nothing but paint mixed with some glue. The wax is so bad and so sticky. Even after taking shower it doesn't go off the skin. Didn't use any of the other lotions that came with this. Probably they are another set of junk since we already have body lotions. I was about to put "all purpose cleaner" on my hands and read the instructions that it was only for Floor or Gigi warmer cleaning. The product would have worth with a better wax. And at the end, I noticed the wax container slightly got split at the bottom and leaked into the warmer - not a lot but a little.

If you get a good warmer anywhere then this product is not worth even to put 50 bucks.
Its good for what we pay. Though, the short trim selection isn't as good as its supposed to be. Worth the price.

i replaced the battery 6-7 years later at $32 and this 2nd battery just gave up(the long-last self-sharpening head still shave well with cord). after reviewing all these reviews about diff kind of shavers and visited norelco website, i am no longer sure if i should just replace the battery the 2nd time or get a new shaver of some kind. i am kind of convinced that people who complained quality, durability, manufacturing countries, etc. in their reviews may all be wrong. the fact is the company trys to sell more shavers so the stock price will keep high, so does management's compensation. i believe the high-paid MBA of comany(not just Philips) figured out it can find money(vs. making money) by forcing users to replace. on norelco website, you can no longer see feature like self-sharpening, you can also forget durable battery. the fact is per the company, you as a user need to spend half to a full price to replace shaver-head or/and battery every year. it is not because they can no longer make the good shaver as it used, or it is because the shaver is now made in a cheap-labor country(by the way, that should increase quality as the company can afford for higher standard there), it is simply because no one except the end-user wants that.

I bought this to replace my not so nice remington trimmer. I think this is a good shaver for trimming body hair.

The guards work just fine for measured trimming despite other complaints. Yeah you must go slowly, but this is so with every body hair trimmer I have ever used.

Wet trimming as well as dry trimming work well. This trimmer doesn't pinch as bad as other shavers I've used, so I'm also not too disappointed with it. In fact, when trimming hair where there is sensitive skin, I find there is much less irritation than with a razor and other trimmers.

My HUGE complaint is the way the guards snap on. When you remove the guard, it sometimes pops the screen loose. I lost my first trimming screen 2 days after receiving the shaver after removing the guard. It went right into my sink drain. Thankfully, the screen isn't made if high-grade stainless steel, or I never would have been able to remove it from the drain with a magnet!

I've used this 6 separate times now. 42 applications in all.
At first I thought the Aquafresh Trays were great.
I then tried "Target" Branded Strips and then back to Aquafresh Trays.

The Aquafresh Trays are more effective than Target Strips, that is for certain, but after 42 uses, I have become more critical of the Aquafresh Trays for the following reasons:

TRAYS ARE FLIMSY
TRAYS DO NOT MAINTAIN GOOD CONTACT OF THE GEL TO YOUR TEETH.
Trays are too stiff to shape to the curvature of your teeth-  this is where strips win over these trays.
The amount of gel in the trays seems to be insufficient to cover more than your 4 front teeth top and bottom.
If you put the tray in nervously and end up getting the gel BEHIND your teeth --- GOOD LUCK GETTING THE GEL ON THE FRONT OF YOUR TEETH.
If you are salivating when putting the trays in, you will not get good contact of gel to your teeth.
SOMETIMES the gel will burn your gums if you smush it past your teeth and onto your gums - especially if it ends up on the lingual gum surfaces.

Having said all this, I will recommend you try them, ONLY if you don't have to pay more than $20/box.  THEY WILL WHITEN YOUR TEETH!!

I am going to buy permanent trays that I hope to mould to the shape of my teeth and use the tubes of gel that will fill the trays.

Upon my return, I called Norelco customer service; but that is another story. . . This is a review for the similar model 7745X. It appears the only difference is that the 7745X has a travel pouch and indicator lights.

I bought this shaver because I was getting nicks several times every week when using the Mach3 / Mach3 Turbo blades. This shaver has addressed that problem, introduced another, and has not eliminated the need for blades.

The shaver does a decent job of shaving the hair off of my cheeks, mustache, and chin. Nowhere near as close as a blade, but nearly good enough (see below). The main problem is when I try to shave hair near my Adam's apple. I consistently end up with red abrasions that last most of the day.

In addition, the design of the shaver makes it unrealistic to shave sideburns. You'd have to disconnect the heads, connect a straight edge (which connects differently than the other heads), shave, and then re-assemble for storage.

My solution: Shave with this shaver. Then follow up with the Mach3 / Mach3 Turbo blades. This way, I can do the sideburns and Adam's apple area. I can also "re-do" the other areas for a closer shave, and for whatever reason, when I do it this way, I don't get nicked.

Other positives: I really like being able to use it in the shower and wash it by placing it in the streaming water. The battery lasts a long time (at least 2 weeks), and the battery indicator is helpful as well.

The lotion dispenser is an interesting gimmick, but I find it totally unnecessary. It doesn't place lubrication on the heads; it just goes on your face, which then makes contact with the heads. Easier just to put something (like soap) on your face, and then use it.

I plan on trying the Remington BHT-2000 body shaver in the next month or two and will compare that unit against this one.

***UPDATE***

I recently purchased the Remington BHT-2000 body shaver and have reviewed it.  Here's is an updated review comparing the Noreclo to the Remington:

To begin, I find the Remington to be more solidly built than the Bodygroom. Plus, the Remington's smaller design makes it easier to maneuver around the groin area than the Bodygroom for trimming that area. Advantage: Remington.

Secondly, I find the trimming capability of the Remington to be better than the Bodygroom. What I don't like about the Norelco is that is comes with flimsy detachable heads to use for trimming. I like how the Remington has a dial-type head (similar to what you see in most beard trimmers) in which you can choose from 5 setting for hair trimming. Advantage: Remington

Thirdly, I found the shaving capability of the Remington to be quite poor compared to the Norelco. For either unit, it is recommended to trim the hair to the lowest setting before attempting to shave using the foil head. If you don't trim the hair first to as short as possible, the shaving head on each unit will not be able to shave the hair properly. Getting back to the review...the Remington dual head shaver attachment is unsatisfactory. It does not shave as close as the Norelco foil head, nor is it as irritation free as the Norelco foil head. I used the foil head on the Remington as gently as possible on both my testicles and part of the shaft, and I felt a stinging razor burn on two separate occasions. Eee-yowch. This did not happen with the Norelco Bodygroom. Advantage: Norelco.

I would recommend that if you plan to simply trim your groin area, then your best bet is to go with the Remington as it is the better trimmer. If your desire is to shave your groin area as smooth as possible with an electric instrument, than your best bet is to go with the Norelco Bodygroom as it is the better shaver. Please understand, however, that even with the Norelco being used as a shaver, you will not experience a shave as close as you would by using a blade.

Based on my experience, I find trimming the groin area to be the way to go instead of shaving the area. In order to keep the groin region hair free, you would have to shave that area every day. I find I can get by with trimming that area to a very short length once a week to keep it rather well maintained.

As others have mentioned, it does not get very hot. Also, you cannot remove the bristles to clean them, and over time hair gets tangled around each little spoke- very unsanitary. Finally, it does not turn off automatically if left sitting for a while - other brands I have used turn off even if I forget to.

Suggested improvement - A stand would have been great so I could put it in my medicine cabinet and not have it roll around my counter.

Tips for using - I found you're better off with dry hair.  When the hair's wet, it's harder for the vacuum to pull it in.  I also found that the vacuum works much better on longer hair then on shorter hair.  Maybe the shorter hairs are too light and get blown around?  Last but not least, watch out for the settings.  The dial goes 1-9 so I started with 4, which was way too short.  I could have grown that beard from scratch in a couple of weeks.  5 also proved a little short for me.  Be sure to start a lot higher than you think you need, and work your way down if needed.

After a year of a good grooming, the unit's switch suddenly got stuck in the "on" position. Middle of the night, total silence in the house.. Except for what sounded like a huge vibrator. Had to shove it under a pillow and wait till the batteries died. Arrrgh.

Now, how do you fix that? Pretty simple. The switch is getting stuck because of the vacuum developing inside of the watertight container. The unit is getting hot in the shower, pressure inside increases, and it (somehow) releases that pressure. Eventually, you are getting enough vacuum to suck the membrane that covers the switch almost all the way in. All you have to do to fix that is let some air in.

First, make sure the unit is dry in and out. Use a compressed air can to blow water drops out of hard to reach places if you have to. You don't want to let any water get inside! Now, remove the head. Just pull it out.

Next, using a flathead screwdriver or utility knife, pull out those silvery colored side moldings. The case will open like a clamshell. You will find a fairly small watertight container with all of the electrical components inside. Carefully pull out any of the latches that are used to keep it closed. Pull two latches if that wasn't enough; your on/off switch membrane will immediately "pop" back into shape.

Reseal the unit back like it was before. Works like new!

I would have thought, due to the high price of this shaver, that it would give just an outstanding shave. Not so. Like another recent reviewer, I have a heavy beard, and the shaver really struggles with it.

I should mention that I'm not a new user. I've now owned mine for over a year. If you read the reviews, you'll see that there have been quality problems with batteries in this model. I got one of the bad ones. Norelco exchanged it under warranty. Annoying, but they didn't give me a hard time. The new unit's battery has behaved flawlessly, and holds a charge good for an absurdly large number of shaves.

Besides the long battery life, a feature I *LOVE* is the ability to clean it under the sink. That is really handy, and not just hype.

I haven't seen any mentions in other reviews of replacement shaving heads. Norelco recommends that you replace them yearly. Like the shaver itself, they're very costly. However, after I replaced them, I did notice an immediate improvement in the feel and quality of the shave.

I think as you read the other reviews here, you may come to the conclusion, as I have, that if you have a heavy beard, this unit will give you a very good, but not great, shave. Combine that with the high initial cost of the unit and the high cost of yearly shaving head replacement, and I can recommend this only if you have a light to medium beard and really must have an electric.

Instead, I STRONGLY recommend that you check out the Gillette M3Power razor if you want the best quality shave. It seems like a gimmick, but it works. It's so good that I have switched back to it, away from this electric unit. Not only is the quality better, but it only costs a fraction of this Norelco.

I purchased this product for the first time only recently, after doing some online research. I was looking for a healthy alternative to a brand that I used for almost a decade. I have about 20% gray hair, more so on my temples, and my natural hair color is dark brown. The Medium Brown 4N by Tints of Nature seemed to be the best match, so I gave it a try. I had nothing to lose but gray hair.

When I got the package, I read everything on the box and in the instructions, just to make sure I'm not missing any warning, as we all know, these things always come with all sorts of warnings. Though, I did not do the allergy test 48 hrs ahead as I never had any allergy issues before, even with brands that are known to be less safe. And I did not regret it, because I had no issues at all. It's been now 5 days since I used it and I am completely fine.

As for the product, I instantly liked it. The color smells very nice, it does not have the typical chemical/toxic smell to it, and I did not even have to turn on the fan in my bathroom. The preparation time is just as with any other brand, as there are two bottles that need to be mixed well, and you are good to start with your journey. The mixed color paste is just thick enough that it does not drip from your hair, and still, you can run your comb through your hair if you need to. I also like that it is made of the certified organic ingredients, and that it has the least amount of the toxic ingredients, which they have to use in order for it to fully cover your gray hair. Be aware that this is not a 100% non-toxic/organic product, however, it is the least toxic permanent hair color that I could find on the market.

In addition, it is made in the UK, and to my knowledge, they need to comply with the much stricter EU safety standards, unlike US manufacturers. That fact alone gives me a piece of mind, as FDA has not changed their laws about the beauty products and their safety since the 70s.

And the most important thing, the hair color came out beautifully. It has a warm tone of the dark brown shade, and it fully covered all my grays. My hair looks shiny and natural. The gray portion got a very slight tint of a dark brown with golden undertones, but they are still very well covered. No one would be able to tell that those were gray hairs at some point. The previous brand that I used to use would give me a very dark brown with black undertone, and it was a bit too dark. I love this product, it is the safest I could find, its packaging is made out of recycled materials, and they use organic ingredients, among other things.

The only thing I don't like is its price. It is about double of what other similar products cost and I have not seen it in any store in CA. Which means, there is shipping time to include in your wait, so I am about to order myself another box.

I highly recommend this brand, and this is after using hair colors on and off for about past 20 years. I started experimenting in my teens, and by now I consider myself an amateur-pro, if there is such a thing.
A little larger than I expected but otherwise looks great and works well. The brush handle was too fat but managed to fit it on upside down between the bristles and handle.

My most recent shaver head was purchased in June 2009 and already it is worn out and this month is January 2010. This shaver head pulls my hair out without cutting it and it takes sometimes up to 10 minutes to shave. With the pricing and that Braun and retail outlets charge me, I am displease with having to purchase a new one. As of this week, I will need to replace the shaver head because it is worn out.

After reading all the great reviews about this product, I eagerly bought it.

My first time using it in the bath....it was great. In my hot bath it dissolved easily and the aromatic smell helped me clear my sinuses (I suffer with spring allergies something awful). Couldn't wait to use it again.

My second time using this, I wasn't so lucky.  Despite my hot bath water, it didn't dissolve completely. Unfortunately, I did not discover this until I was in the tub. Enough "grit" was left undissolved where I ended up in pain; it scratched my hind quarters so badly that I was actually bleeding in a few spots. Needless to say, the pain I felt from the mustard bath water, on my scratches (and few cuts, to be honest) was immense. Later that night I had to resort to having my husband apply Vitamin E to my scratches -just so I could get some relief. The next day, I am still in pain.

I'm not sure what went wrong. My bath water was sufficiently hot enough to dissolve the mustard bath. I used it one other time, with no issues. However, I am NEVER going to use this, in my bath, again. Interestingly enough, the product packaging contained no warnings, whatsoever. In hindsight, I find that strange.

If you must use it, my recommendation is to use it for a foot soak, only.

I have owned this product for over 4 years now, and I use it quite frequently. I am deciding to write a review on this product based on my negative experience with the product. So far in the last 5 years I have owned two of this product. The original one I purchased from Amazon, and the subsequent one from Wal-Mart.

The product works great at first. Knocks out the hair, works both wet and dry (though I never thought it worked very well wet), and recharges in a flash.

Unfortunately, after a few months of use - the replaceable shaving piece came loose and would fall out whenever I turned the product upside down or when I hit a snag while using it that cause it to pop up a little bit. This makes using the product next to impossible if you're using it without a guard. I have even gone as far as replacing the entire shaving piece and the product still falls out. So it is the base shaver that has gotten loose and broken off a piece that stops the product from working as well.

This has happened to BOTH of the shavers that I have used and it starts to happen after about 6 months of use. All in all I like the product and for the price it works very well. It is because of these things coming loose that I have dropped it down 2 stars.

I purchased the three pack of the tea tree and hemp oil kind when it was still available on here for about $16.00 (though strangely enough the price randomly dropped since then). I've been trying to find a good alternative for my particular hair/skin type while being an all natural shampoo. I have adult acne and my hair gets greasy very easily, so I've always had difficulty with skin sensitivity and buildup on the scalp. To be specific, my skin is actually combination (oily and dry in some places), which complicates things all the more. That being said, if you don't have the same skin/hair type as me, then this may or may not apply to you...

I was hoping to find a good enough alternative that it wouldn't matter if I skipped a day of hair cleaning (to keep some good natural oils in my hair) like a lot of people with non-oily skin can do. This is my first time using an all natural shampoo, let alone a shampoo bar (everyone I know looks at me like I'm crazy when I mention its form but I still like the idea), and I was intrigued enough after reading a lot of reviews on here and elsewhere.

So, I'm about halfway through my first bar and it's not quite met my expectations. It was ordered on June, 15th and I received it only a few days later and have used it up until this point every day or every other day. The bar does melt quite a bit even if you have it sitting on a surface where it's not submerged in a stagnant pool. A dry area. Instead of being the semi-solid form it was when I got it, it now has a waxy appearance... like golden melted wax formed into a halfway melted square shape. Melted beeswax is the closest comparison. This might not be unusual, since it's mostly oils, but it changes the way it feels when putting it into my hair. Also, I've found that it hasn't done anything to clear up the buildup on my scalp. Again, this could just be my own hair type, but it is strange that all these natural oils haven't done anything to help my dandruff. If anything, it may be slightly worse. Still, if you don't take your time in rinsing it out (emphasis on this right here), then it will leave most of, if not at least some of your hair very oily, which you'll notice when it dries. I've found the best way to do it is to let it sit in your hair for a good few minutes, then take a good five or so minutes of just rinsing, making sure to get everywhere more than once, since it does coat. I was wondering why my hair ended up oily a few times using this and discovered taking your time rinsing really does show the best results.

As for the good, I've noticed it does lather more than I expected despite no foaming agents, which I like. All you have to do is run it for a few seconds through each part of your hair and you're golden. Another positive is that it doesn't have a strong smell. The light smell it does have isn't half bad. Despite not showing too much improvement with my hair's condition versus store bought shampoos, on the bright side, it doesn't dry out my hair and at least it's all natural, right?

Even when I clean it all out, unfortunately my hair isn't super luscious and silky smooth (someday...). It is soft though, but still fluffy. At least for the first 24 hours. Again, my hair gets oily easily, so I'm going to guess that this might just be the wrong combination of oils or perhaps I should stop putting off that visit to a dermatologist. Once I get through the three bars, I'll order a different kind of J.R. Liggett's and see if there's any improvement with a different kind, but for now, this is an "okay" buy.

I'm not sure why the longer shaving time, but I sense that the shavers spin slower than my old Norelco. It is quiet, which was important to me, and, ultimately, I do get a fairly close shave. The pop-up trimmer works fine and the recharging stand is convenient.  I like the form-fitted case. The head opens too easily, so I'm forever cleaning up shaving stubble due to accidental openings. I cannot comment on the battery life, as it is still too new to see how economical the shaver is, however I can say that a full charge lasts me about a week (five shaves). Overall, I'm fairly satisfied, notwithstanding the above disappointments, but I cannot say I'm "wowed" by this new model over my older model.

I've shaved with Braun electric models since early 1980's.  They were great products then, but their foil/cutter durability has degraded badly under Gillette, now P&G (they should give away the shavers, since they are really selling high-margin disposables.)  The thin foil and cutter are now designed to wear out rapidly: I shave carefully, have moderate beard growth, but still only get 4 to 5 months from a foil before it breaks and nicks.  Forget their 18 month change suggestion--it won't last that long.  If you don't mind the high expense of consumables, the 8000 series does provide a very clean comfortable shave while the foil is new.  I find shaving quite fast in the first month, considerably slower by 3rd month, then watchout for foil failure and nicks.  If you want durable performance, get a Norelco rotary.  When a Braun foil breaks, I use a 1960's vintage Norelco triple-head.  It still works just fine, and only costs electricity since the cutters last several years in daily use on my beard.  Its downside is manual cleaning, and a shave (old cutters/thicker foils) not quite as close as a new Braun foil/cutter.  It also takes a little longer than a new Braun foil/cutter to get a good shave, but it's faster than a 3-4 month old Braun f/c.
I ordered this soap and could barely detect a scent to it. I have always ordered Plantlife brand and it smells heavenly!

I bought an expensive Norelco "Spectra" about eight weeks ago. I don't find it better than my last new and expensive Norelco, a "Quad Action," or whatever last year's "Razor-du-Jour" from Norelco was called, and I'm really disappointed.  Each year the Norelco offers less and less value.  (Ratio of quality to price.) It is not as close, and it takes longer to shave.  The only difference I can see is the little adjustment wheel, which they've had before in different forms, the pretty pearlized colors, and the the holes versus slots moved to a different location on the perimeter of each of the three circular heads. The holes are much closer shaving, as they have always been on foil razors. Norelco claims that the slots are better for "longer hairs," but if you shave every day, why would you have "longer hairs" on your face? The bottom line is that this model is NOT faster or closer than the previous one, although it's a bit smoother, but it IS more expensive. I keep buying these in the hope that each successive one is actually an improvement, rather than a marketing device with marginal changes. (And the "James Bond" tie-in promotional gift is simply, well, juvenile.  Anyone old enough to shave can see this is useless and unrelated.  A small package of pre-shave, a shaving stick, or cleaning/soaking fluid would make more sense.)  But the truth of the matter in my experience is that any of the past three major models ("Spectra," "Quad," "Reflex," whatever) are comparable if you use an appropriate pre-shave, clean the shaver often, and replace the heads as needed.  (The ability to rinse the razor clean WAS significant, however.)  The closest Norelco was the one with the micro-thin indentation in the center of each circular head around the perimeter. The fastest one had 36 (I think) cutting blades, instead of the reduced number now. (When I asked Norelco why they cut the number of blades, they said it had something to do with the "hair reservoir." What happened to the hair before?) I will continue to use Norelco, and I own three of them.  I have used them for 48 years, and they're still the best rotary razor.  But I wish they would wait for REAL improvements before releasing a new razor. (Maybe then the price wouldn't be so exorbitant, either.)

The all-in-one notion is useful, though it does not work as well as dedicated products.  As a nose-hair trimmer, it works, but not as effectively as one I had which was dedicated to that purpose - this one takes longer to do it.  As a facial-hair trimmer, it works, though it seems a little flimsy compared to an older Norelco beard-trimmer I used before the battery died.  You have to be careful that the length setting doesn't change while you're using it.

The transformer is not multi-voltage.  It works ONLY on 110-120 VAC (USA voltage) and NOT on 220v systems, which is the rule in Europe and common in Asia.  The USA voltage requirement is not mentioned in the specifications here, or on the box, and I bought it assuming multi-voltage since the earlier Norelco trimmer had it.  I may well return the product because of this problem.

If you don't travel outside of the USA, it's a reasonable jack-of-all-trades, master-of-none product that does what it says reasonably well, though a bit flimsy in use.
